story:
Agavi:  Digital Science and Technology Education Everywhere

Education technology.  For too many teachers it's expensive, uninspired, or takes too long to learn.  Not only that, it often requires reliable high speed internet and cutting-edge devices to run ... leaving rural, impoverished, and disabled teachers and students behind.

We are a team of teachers and technologists and we are working to change that.  Lev has 20 years of science teaching experience through various in-person, hybrid, flipped, and online classroom settings across the US and globally.  Bianca, Alex, and Wayne are enthusiastic programmers eager to improve technologies used in classrooms around the world, especially those in overlooked communities.  Manuela is a user experience designer keen to develop simple and intuitive interfaces so that anyone can easily pick up and use educational technology.  We are scattered all over the world, but united in the quest to change digital education for the better.

Enter Agavi.

Agavi is an adaptive learning platform designed by 21st century teachers for 21st century teachers and students.  With just a few taps on your smartphone, you'll be able to create tasks you can deploy to your students.  What's a task?  You can obviously show some text or videos and ask questions, but any system can do this 20th-century-style passive learning.  What if you could move beyond the screen and:

  • Geotag tasks and activities to unique sites to guide students in the field or even around their immediate surroundings?
  • Connect to internal smartphone sensors to access physical data (like angle of tilt or compass directions) that can immediately be used in classroom activities?
  • Connect to external sensors to train students in lab and fieldwork skills?

 

Then, imagine sequencing all your diverse tasks into an experience and deploying it to your students even without a reliable internet connection.  You'll be able to build choose-your-own adventure activities where you can:

  • Create branching and alternative pathways for your students to follow
  • Integrate team and individual tasks into the same experience
  • Assign different teams to different interlinked tasks all within the same experience

 

When your experience is live, you'll be able to track your students through actionable analytics that will show you what your students are doing and what they need help with right when they are working.  In your teacher interface, you'll get:

  • A live view of where all your students are in the experience
  • Ability to quickly identify problem points
  • Quick and easy access to what a student has already done to help you diagnose problems and propose solutions quickly and easily

 

Whether you have a strong internet connection or not, you'll be able to use Agavi, as we are designing it to have a low power and bandwidth footprint and even be deployable on a local network, such as a Raspberry Pi communicating with a few local devices.

That's only the first step.

As the platform grows, together we will be building a global community that lets teachers share and improve each others' activities.  We'll be incorporating AI to help teachers adapt content on the network to their local environment and its specific challenges, as well as building a research platform to investigate not just how students learn but also how teachers build, modify, adapt, and share content (currently extremely difficult to study!).  Plus, Agavi will have an API so that you can build your own instrumentation that connects to and communicates with the system, expanding it beyond even what we can imagine!

Sounds pretty 21st century for a learning system, right?  But we can't build this alone.  We need your help.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $50,000 to get started.  All of us are volunteers and work on this system in our spare time, which can sometimes make progress painfully slow.  But with a bit of starting capital, we can pay for initial server and database costs as well as people's time so that we can build this platform faster.

And you can be along for the ride!  Become an early tester or even help guide the development of the platform.  We can't anticipate every community's teaching needs, but if you talk, we'll listen!

The Impact

Lev has worked with teachers in Ukraine and eastern Indonesia and has seen firsthand how lack of infrastructure or affordable options hamper good teaching.  He wants to change that.  Bianca, Alex, Wayne, and Manuela jumped on board because they believe there can and should be a better option for teachers everywhere.

With Agavi, we aim not just to make creating adaptive and creative digital lessons easier, but also more accessible to vulnerable and underserved populations around the world.  This isn't just another flashy edtech.  It's edtech on a mission to serve those who have been ignored by the edtech sector.

Risks & Challenges

As with any technology, the biggest risk is in scope creep and budgets exploding due to unforeseen technical challenges.  To mitigate against this, we will deploy the simplest system we can into paying customers' hands as early as possible so that we can quickly establish an income stream that can help fund continued development and expansion of the system.  Additionally, we have a "rainy day" fund through Science Voices, our nonprofit, that can help cushion some unexpected expenses.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially now, that's OK!  Get the word out to your friends or share with teachers who are looking for simpler, more powerful edtech tools for science and technology teaching.  Additionally you can:

  • Join the team and help with design and programming
  • Help test the system
  • Talk to us about what your teaching challenges are and what features could help you

 

For more information and updates, follow us here or visit us at:

www.agavi-ed.org

www.sciencevoices.org

Or follow Science Voices on Facebook

story:
Summary

If you have trouble making a donation through this site, you can donate directly to the school via our website: https://www.vancouverislandschoolart.com/donate...

The Vancouver Island School of Art (VISA) was founded in 2004 and is the only independent art school in BC with transfer agreements to university studies. To date more than 4,000 students have taken courses and workshops at the school, and after 15 years in the Quadra Village location, VISA is excited to have found a permanent home in the heart of downtown Victoria. Moving downtown to a beautiful commercial space in a historic building is a dream come true. However the expenses associated with the move are sizeable for a small non-profit arts organization during a global pandemic. We need your support to make this happen!

What We Need & What You Get

• VISA needs to raise $10,000 to cover the cost of the first month's rent and deposit, leasehold improvements and the cost of the move itself. Moving an art school is a big endeavour!

• Donations of $500 or more will receive an original silkscreen by renowned Vancouver artist Alan Wood (1935-2017): "Alan Wood was one of Canada’s leading artists. He received international acclaim for his use of colour, and for his undertaking of the large-scale outdoor environmental work, “Ranch”. These colourful, ready-to-frame works on paper are currently selling at $750 at the Petley Jones Gallery in Vancouver. Included with each print is a 15% off coupon for Prestige Framing.

• Donations of $200 or more will receive a Draw by Drawing Kit

• Donations of $100 or more will receive a Watercolour Kit  or Pastel Kit

• Donations of $25 or more will receive a handmade collage postcard by artist and Vancouver Island School of Art Executive Director, Wendy Welch.

Donors can choose to receive a tax receipt in lieu of the above perks, or if they donate above the cost of the perk (i.e. $100 for a $25 postcard perk, will receive a $75 tax receipt with the perk).

The Impact

VISA is very excited to move downtown to a central location that is accessible to all. After years of being in older buildings with stairs and no elevators, the school will now be in a building equipped with an elevator and a wheelchair accessible washroom at 302-733 Johnson St. Our new space is bright and open, has high ceilings and an outdoor patio space, and is located right across the street from the Johnson St. parkade. It's the perfect environment for learning about art, and we can't wait to welcome you to the space when in person classes reopen.

The pandemic has been a challenging time for all, especially arts organizations. VISA made the necessary adaptations and transitioned to online course offerings.  The school immediately became aware of how important art courses are to people, especially seniors facing social isolation, and put all its resources into maintaining the programming and classes.

Our lease at the Kings Rd. school expired, so a move was necessary. The added expenses associated with relocating during the pandemic is an additional challenge for the school. Any support you can offer towards these costs, will be most appreciated. This move will solidify the strength of the organization, as VISA now has a permanent location with a long-term lease. We know you will love our new space as much as we do!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

• Please share our campaign on Facebook, Instgram and Twitter
• Enrol in one of our online summer courses: https://www.vancouverislandschoolart.com
• Donate art supplies to sell at our moving sale (drop off at 950 Kings Rd)
• Attend our moving sale on May 15, 2021, 10am-3pm at 950 Kings Rd. (COVID protocols will be in place)

story:
Do you know what's happening above your head?

Despite all our technological advances, we still don’t understand much about the long-period comets, small asteroids, and streams of meteoroids hurtling around our cosmic neighborhood. In fact, Cameras for Allsky Meteor Surveillance (CAMS), the world's most comprehensive meteor-spotting network, has a blindspot over the Northeastern hemisphere. 

YOU can change this. If we raise just $25k, we can patch the gap in the CAMS network with a student-run observatory in India to ensure scientists have eyes on the skies everywhere 24/7. 

By funding this observatory, you’ll ensure planetary scientists don’t miss out on data about our solar system and empower computer science students who will help maintain the observatory and use the data collected for hands-on projects.

And all donations to this project are tax deductible! We've also already recieved a generous $5k donation from a passionate donor!

What We Need & What You Get

Donate today to help purchase the 48 cameras and computers needed to establish the observatory. You’ll ensure scientists have key data to help understand our solar system while empowering the next generation of computer scientists. Ensure we have eyes on the entire night sky 24/7!

The Details

CAMs technology

The observatory will be a part of the SETI Institute’s CAMS project, a global network of citizen-run CCTV cameras that captures data on meteor showers and meteorites. Typical observatories observe light to make findings, but CAMS records particles interacting with the Earth’s atmosphere. This is a unique and efficient way to study the streams of meteoroids in the path of comets and asteroids. To do this, CAMS uses low-light CCTV cameras at stations across the globe—548 in total. Currently, there are CAMS sites in the USA, Europe, United Arab Emirates, Australia, New Zealand, Chile, South Africa, Brazil, and Namibia.

Each station has 16 cameras, and each camera generates 10 Gb of data per night. When a meteor is detected against the star background, it must then be triangulated with at least two other stations to determine their trajectory and speed.

Meteor science

Meteors are the light caused by rocky objects in space when they hit Earth’s atmosphere. They range in size from dust grains to small asteroids, and when Earth crosses the streams of such objects, meteor showers occur. 

The CAMS network has used meteor shower data to detect the debris streams from comets in our solar system that have not yet been seen. This is especially important if the object could one day pose an impact threat to Earth.

The cameras on occasion also detect meteorite falls. Meteorites, the part of space rocks that survive passage through Earth's atmosphere, can help us understand how the planets formed and maybe even how life originated here on Earth. 

Machine learning

As the tools of astronomy become more powerful, scientists have an exponential amount of data to use and machine learning coupled with responsive infrastructure is the key to making sense of this incredible amount of information. Here are the ways both have improved CAMS:

  • Automating and scaling data injestion and processing pipeling
  • Creating and training meteor-identifying algorithm that identifies events on par with scientists
  • Data visualization to see the activity of the entire night sky around the globe

And the team has made all the data collected by the network available to the public—students and citizen scientists alike—by displaying the results in near-time at http://meteorshowers.seti.org/

Citizen scientists

One of the great things about CAMS is if you have interest and commitment, you can set up and run your own CAMS site. There are more than 100 citizen scientists involved in the project, including amateur astronomers and students. Learn more about CAMS here.

The team

story:
Research Support Summary

I am Kelee Siat, a second year part time PhD student at the University of Manchester, UK. I have always been academically focused and found that employment and passion are not always mutually affectionate, but aspiration and determination are. After many upheavals, I altered my career pathway in 2011 waitressing to supplement my income and pay for tuition. In 2019 I had the opportunity to apply and be accepted for a research PhD in Egyptology. 6 months into my research the pandemic hit, though I am fortunate to have a part time job from home, I am beginning to see possible restrictions to my research studies at home.

This campaign is to help lift some of these research restrictions by being able to purchase books containing texts and translations that cannot be accessed from university locations due to lending restrictions and the ongoing pandemic. I am looking for funds to aid in my tuition payment for my current academic year 2 and for contribution towards books and archive material for my continuing research.  

What you as a contributor will be able to help me achieve is a unique opportunity to advance research in the realm of understanding the presence of women in ancient diplomatic correspondence, a topic that has not been significantly addressed in the field of Egyptology. You will be contributing to the research of our collective ancient past. 

The contribution that you are choosing to make will contribute to our understanding and analysis of the records of the ancient past. Your support will bring me closer to the completion of my PhD and provide the resources to continue into my next academic year of study. 

What is needed & what you get for your contribution

I am currently hoping to raise a total of £1325 for research and resources. £750 will go towards my tuition fees for the current academic year. This will enable me to have secure funding available to complete my second year and permit my focus to be on my research without worry. £575 will be used towards the purchasing of rare or much needed books and materials.

Your contributions and what you will receive: 

  • £1 Coffee Tier - you receive a thank you for your token towards my research fund. 
  • £5 Coffee & Research Tier - Your support on this tier will provide coffee fuel motivation to move forward with my research and you will receive a newsletter email update of my progress for the end of my academic year 2021 acknowledging what you have helped me accomplish through your support.
  • £10 Scribal Stationary Tier - you will receive a set of Scribal Stationary, 10 sheets of A5 paper, hand tea dyed.
  • £50 Scribal Appreciation Tier - As a campaign backer, you will receive a printed newsletter update about my progress in the summer and receive 20 sheets of my hand tea dyed scribal stationary paper. 
  • £100 Scribal Research Appreciation Tier - you will receive a set of 20 sheets of my hand tea dyed scribal stationary paper, a printed newsletter of my progress and a personally transcribed passage from an ancient Egyptian text in penned hieroglyphs on my tea dyed paper.  

Impact

Your contribution makes a historic difference by contributing.

  • My research is unique to the field of Egyptology at PhD level.
  • You are enabling research into ancient texts and ancient individuals in a time that forged unique diplomatic relations and also a time right before a confusing collapse of many societies. 
  • Your contribution at every level is a token of generosity and will add to my focus and determination to complete my PhD and give back in return through my teaching aspirations. 

Research Challenges

Hurdles are inevitable, and there might be moments where those elusive books are available one minute and gone the next. I might need to wait a bit longer and this could impact my research. My tuition is completely self-funded at the moment and this might have unforeseen challenges in the years to come in fully completing my PhD. However, I have been persistent not to give up and your contributions will make a huge difference in the immediacy of any of these challenges. I am certain that the research foundation I am building now and in the immediate future will be a strong footing for my future in Egyptology. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can’t contribute monetarily doesn’t mean that your well wishes would not go unrecognised! Thank you for taking the time to just read my story and what I hope I can achieve. You can also share my campaign and there are share tools available on Indiegogo with this campaign and others.

story:
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

A Day in Code: Python is now available on Amazon: 

https://www.amazon.com/Day-Code-Python-Illustrated-Beginners/dp/1735907944

 

 

                                  

 

                                               

                                                                    Cover updated 2/10/21

 

The beach…an amusement park…delicious desserts. From early in the morning till late at night, this brother and sister's epic day is described with Python computer programs!

 

 

 

Back cover:  This picture book tells the story of a day packed with fun activities like eating cookies and playing miniature golf. But this is no ordinary story- it's written in the Python programming language. Don't know Python? This will help you learn it. Also, there's English translations!

 

The story is told with “code pages” next to full-page illustrations. Each code page contains a complete Python program that introduces a new Python concept. The full-page illustration next to each code page shows the situation being described in code.

 

Code page:

 

Illustration page:

                  

 

You can run each program on your computer! Python is free to download and install. You can also use a free online Python compiler.

 

                             

 

Every program prints output to the screen with a print function. Modify values and have fun playing with the code!

 

Important note: Pizza WILL be in this story.  

Sneak peek: 

 

...and cake!

 

 

 

 

Everyone! 

Younger children can enjoy this book as a fun picture book with the benefit of being exposed to logical thinking and code. 

Older kids and adults can gain a more in-depth understanding of programming concepts and Python by reading the programs and code explanations (and enjoying the pictures!).

The Python programs that make up the story also serve as useful code examples to look back on to refresh your memory of concepts and syntax.

 

 

Give the gift of learning to code

Programming is a valuable skill you can apply to create useful applications and products. There are infinite possibilities! It also strengthens other skills including logical thinking, creativity, decision making, planning, problem solving, and focus.

 

Python is a high-level (human-readable) programming language that is known for being easy to learn. The Python Standard Library has a large collection of built-in functions and modules that can be used in your code to make it easier to perform tasks.

 

 

A Day in Code: Python will cover the basics of Python, including the following topics:

  • Syntax
  • Keywords
  • Strings and data types
  • Operators
  • Input/Output
  • Conditional statements and loops
  • Lists, dictionaries, and tuples
  • Functions and methods
  • Classes and objects
  • Modules

 

Where is Python used?

For students and hobbyists, the Raspberry Pi (https://www.raspberrypi.org) board is a popular platform commonly programmed with Python. You can connect it to a display, keyboard, and mouse to use it as a desktop PC. You can also connect it to electronic components with input/output pins and use it for hardware and Internet of Things (IoT) projects.

 

Here are some prominent applications that commonly use Python:

  • Data science and analysis
  • AI and Machine learning
  • Scientific and numeric computing
  • Computer vision
  • Web development and apps
  • Game development

 

 

 

Funding will be used for the following:

  • Completing the illustrations with a hired artist
  • Layout and formatting
  • Printed proofs and setup costs
  • Hardcover book production
  • Fulfillment/shipping

 

Hi, I’m Shari Eskenas! Creativity and innovation are important to me. I founded Sundae Electronics LLC with the mission of creating a brand focused on inventing and creating innovative consumer electronics products. I have big plans for the future!

A Day in Code: Python will follow my first book, A Day in Code: An illustrated story written in the C programming language. C is the language of embedded systems in electronics, so naturally I chose to write my first book in the C language. A Day in Code was launched on Kickstarter in June 2020. With the support of 532 amazing backers, A Day in Code became a reality and books were delivered to backers in October 2020.

 

 

With the positive response received for A Day in Code and requests for versions written in other programming languages, I decided I wanted to write a Python version because of its popular demand and its strengths for various applications. While C is a fast, efficient language that is optimal for embedded electronics, Python is more power-hungry and is best suited for software applications like data analysis and AI/machine learning.

Python is seen as an easier language because it’s more human-readable than C programming. For example, to test if two conditions are true, you use logical AND. In C programming, logical AND is given by the double ampersand symbol &&, whereas in Python it is literally the word “and”- as you can see on the sample code page.

 

An Alternate Universe

Rather than simply change the code from C to Python, I decided that the fun events in the story would be a little different too. The story’s epic day would be an alternate universe!

For example, the characters in A Day in Code: Python will eat waffles for breakfast instead of pancakes. They will win stuffed dragons instead of unicorns. But of course they still eat pizza…just in a different setting.

                                   

But the goal remains the same: to use a fun approach to inspire readers to think logically and learn how to program. I can’t wait to bring this book to life…I’m so excited to be on this journey with you!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
A Day in Code: Python is now available on Amazon:

story:
The world's first smartwatch application for guitar, bass, ukulele, and piano!
Wristruments is the new most intuitive way to learn instruments.
 

 

 

 

 

LEARN like never before.

  • New, hands-free learning technology.
  • Quick and easy lessons help you learn at your own pace.
     

Freedom to learn anywhere.

True hands-on learning experience.

 

PRACTICE with purpose, every time.

  • Play almost anything with your new library of chords, scales, and songs.
  • Become a better musician every time you pick up your instrument.
     

Practice anywhere, anytime.

Select rhythm (chords & progressions) or lead (scales & riffs) mode!

 

PLAY any new song, instantly.

  • Your entire song library, right on your wrist. 

  • Sing and play easier than every with colored chords & scrolling lyrics.
     

 

     

    100% Personalized 

    Completely Custom interface

     

    The Ultimate Tool for Any Musician

    All supporters get immediate access to Wristruments for Guitar
    on Apple Watch and receive all updates before the final release.

     

     

    What People Are Saying

    Our Story

    We've been bootstrapping Wristruments until now, and are now taking pre-orders before releasing the full version on the App Store in December 2020.

     
     
     

    Development & Stretch Goals

     

     

     

     
     
     

    Learn... Practice... Play!

story:
Our Story, From Katie

EDUCATION + DANCE + COMMUNITY SERVICE = LOVE

5 years ago I went to Uganda for the first time to volunteer, teaching Senior 2 English at a secondary school deep in the village. Out of my class of about 55 students, only 2 girls remain in school today, one of which is our sponsee, Recheal.  Without sponsorship, EVERY OTHER GIRL from my class has since dropped out of school, and nearly ALL of them have given birth to one or two children.  Today, these bright young women are stuck at home in their villages- jobless, living in poverty, now with their own children suffering.  5 years ago, I came to Uganda just hoping to give Love and be of service to others.  I had no idea then that Uganda would become my life, and the people, my family.  I have been back to Uganda 5 times and with the help of Lara Martin and Lindsey Hedrick, co-founded a 501c3 nonprofit, called Project: More Love.  We have come SO far, and yet this is just the beginning. Our biggest goal this year is to raise enough money for Recheal to go University, but we are not stopping there!   

The Impact

Your support is a crucial part of a collective effort to let young women in Uganda know they are not forgotten, they are valuable, they are worth educating, and they can make a difference in their communities.  There is hope!  Project: More Love is a grassroots, locally supported charity, that sponsors upper level education for girls.  Our work is vital because no other organization in the district is focusing on this issue.  University education is expensive and many Ugandans feel that girls are not worth educating, but we disagree.  We are rising to the challenge. 

In Uganda, many people die from preventable diseases because they don't have access to clean water, proper health care or nutrition.  The unemployment rate in Uganda is the highest in all of Africa, and more than 38% of the population is living below the international poverty rate of $1.25 USD per day.  On a more personal level, at a workshop for young women in our village, most of them admitted to being forced to resort to prostitution for something as trivial as a bar of soap.  As a teacher, friend, and human being - I cannot even express the sadness and outrage I felt hearing these beautiful girls speak out. The challenges we are facing are vast and overwhelming. 

BUT, instead of just focusing on a mountain of problems- at Project: More Love we choose to focus on Love.  Individuals who are suffering are not problems to be solved, but people to be Loved.  We believe that investing in one young woman, is investing in an entire community.

Year after year, our sponsee, Recheal has proven to be exceptional.  She is as talented as she is bright, and her giving heart and creative spirit are truly one of a kind.  With a University degree, she has the chance to break out of a cycle of poverty and become self-supporting.  She can become a positive mentor & role model for the young girls and boys growing up in her village.  She has the chance to inspire change not only her own life, but in the lives of all who know her.  We are so proud of her and we Love her dearly!  For the past two years, we have been successful in raising school fees for Recheal, but now we are facing our biggest and most expensive challenge yet- University.  Please help Recheal continue studying.  Together, one small step at a time, we can do it!

What We Need & Where Donations Will Go

  • Our first priority is Recheal's University education & we need to raise $12000.  **This includes housing, meals, transportation, books, and a lap top, all of which she needs in order to be a successful University student.**
  • The second part of our budget is for opening an office on the ground in Uganda. As we continue to grow, we absolutely need a headquarters with a PO Box, phone, internet, and meeting space for our Uganda staff and students.  This will cost approximately $3500 for 1 year.
  • Third, and this is where transparency comes in - we need help getting out of "the red".  We are small, grassroots nonprofit and to date, all of our staff have been working for free and investing their own time & money into making this project work.  Going forward, we have sustainable fundraising strategies in place, but we are calling on our supporters to help us get jump-started in 2015.  We need $3500 to break even, and have budgeted $6000 total salary for all of our staff in Uganda for 1 year.
  • Any extra funds will go directly towards the sponsorship of more students! Each student in our program gets the highest level of mentorship, job training, and support.  We believe in the value of quality over quantity. 

Here's the breakdown of how we plan to allocate our funds:

  • $12000 - Recheal's University education
  • $3500 - Ugandan office/headquarters
  • $3500 - Start Up Costs
  • $6000 - Salary for entire staff in Uganda for 1 year

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute money, but there are other BIG ways to help:

  • Spread the Love and tell friends, family & coworkers about our campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!  They're easy.
  • Volunteer at PML events or attend our monthly yoga classes.
  • Call someone and tell them you Love them, dance, laugh, forgive.

story:
(Français en dessous)

El Manantial Mindo

Hello, my name is Genny, I was born in the highlands of Ecuador 41 years ago. I was fortunate enough that my parents supported me in working hard at school, which eventually lead me to obtain a scholarship for college education in Europe. There, I experienced first hand what it is to have so many doors open thanks to a good education, but above all thanks to the awareness that everyone has the right and the capacity to pursue their own dreams.

El Manantial educational center was built starting March 2014, by 12 families, 15 children, 3 guides and many friends. So far all has been funded with the effort, time, and money brought in by the families. Now, it is time to open the project to others!

The driving idea of our project, is to provide our children and the local community with an education alternative based on respect, creativity, freedom and an overall healthy and supportive evironment for their unlimited development - for boys AND girls.

We use active education methods and materials (Montessori, alternative) and prepared environments to open as many possibilities in the minds and spirits of the children.  We also support practical learning with activities and experiences involving nature and the day to day of the local community.

Mindo is afterall a birdwatching paradise and mega-diverse natural spot, but it is also a village where half of the population lives under the poverty threshold, alcoolism and domestic violence and abuse are rampant, and lots remains to be done in terms of infrastructure, health and above all, education.

Your support

will help us to promote within the community the concepts of:

  • quality education (as opposed to learning by heart and complying to rules)
  • equality for little girls (often relegated to household chores, and discouraged from pursuing their development)
  • respect and collaboration
  • individual initiative and responsibility
  • environmental awareness
  • integral health awareness (mind, body, nutrition, women's health)

What do we need?

Needs are neverending of course :)
but these are our priorities for the school year starting April 2015:

  • 5 full scholarships for local children with no resources 9.000$
  • Maintenance and building 1.200$ (build an additional room for the 8-10 year olds, repair the thatch roof of the communal space for the little ones)
  • Making and purchasing of learning materials 800$
  • Organize events and workshops to promote integral education within the local community 4.000$.

Children are a crucial door to families and especially to mothers here in Ecuador. Babies and toddlers are cherished, but soon the demands of large families and few resources pile up the responsibilities and hard work on very young kids.

We want to build a trusting relationship with the town mothers, so that they find a space with us to talk about their problems: parenting, family life, health, self-worth.
In our culture, mothers are the main influence who promote self-esteem and open the world to their children... or not.

We believe we can create this safe and supportive space from within, starting with the children, by way of integrating them to our Center and to our community events.

Please donate! Even 10$ can make a difference for the future of a little one!

If you cannot contribute financially, we are more than happy if you help us spreading the word about our project!

We also welcome donations of learning materials, books (in french and english too!), costumes, and we offer volunteer and sponsorship opportunities.

From the heart of the cloud forest of Ecuador,

THANK YOU!

*******************************************

El Manantial Mindo

Je m'appelle Genny, je suis née en Equateur, sur les hauts-plateaux des Andes il y a 41 ans. J'ai eu la chace d'avoir des parents qui m'ont soutenue dans mes étides, ce qui m'a permis d'obtenir une bourse pour mes études supérieures en Europe. C'est là que j'ai pu fair l'expérience de ce que cela signifie de voir les portes s'ouvrir grâce à une bonne éducation, mais surtout grâce au fait de savoir que toute personne à le droit et la capacité de poursuivre ses idéaux.

Le centre d'éducation El Manantial s'est construit en May 2014, avec l'effort, le temps et l'argent de 12 familles, 15 enfants, 3 guides et beaucoup d'amis. Maintenant, il est temps de s'ouvrir au reste de la communauté!

L'idée moteur de ce projet est d'offrir aux enfants de la communauté locale une éducation alternative basée sur le respect, la créativité, la liberté, et surtout sur la base d'une environnement sain qui encourage un développement illimité – pour garçons ET filles.

Nous utilisons des méthodes et des matériels actifs (Montessori, alternatifs) et des environnments préparés pour ouvrir autant de possibilités intellectuelles et viventielles que possible. Nous encourageons aussi l'apprentissage pratique avec des activités et des expériences dans la nature et dans le jour le jour de la communauté.

Mindo est après tout un paradis des amateurs d'oiseaux et un endroit connu pour sa méga-diversité naturelle, mais c'est aussi un village où la moitié de la population vit en dessous du seuil de pauvreté, où l'alcoholisme et la violence et l'abus domestiques sont courants; tant reste à faire au niveau des infrastructures, de la santé et surtout de l'éducation.

Votre soutien

Nous aidera à promouvoir dans la communauté les concepts suivants:

  • éducation de qualité (à l'opposé de la mémorisation et de se soumettre à des règlements arbitraires)
  • égalité pour les petites (et plus grandes) filles (souvent souscrites aux tâches ménagères, et trouvant des obstacles pour poursuivre leur développement)
  • respect et collaboration
  • initiative et responsibilité individuelle
  • conscience des enjeux écologiques
  • conscience de la santé personnelle et familiale (connaissances, conscience corporelle, nutrition, santé féminine)

De quoi avons-nous besoin?

Il y a toujours des nouveaux besoins bien-sûr :)
mais voici nos priorités pour l'année scolaire qui commence en Avril 2015:

  • 5 bourses complètes pour des enfants sans resources 9.000$
  • Entretien et construction 1.200$ (constructioin d'une nouvelle salle pour les grands 8-10 ans, réparation du toit de chaume de l'espace communal des petits)
  • Fabrication et achat de matériels d'apprentissage 800$
  • Organisation d'événements et ateliers pour promouvoir l'éducation intégrale dans la communauté locale 4.000$.
Les enfants sont une porte dans la vie des familles, et en particulier une connexion avec les mamans ici en Equateur. Les bébés et les petits enfants sont adorés, mais malheureusement bientôt les responsabilités et le travail qu'exigent les familles nombreuses et le peu de ressources, s'entassent sur les épaules des enfants.


Nous cherchons à construire une relation de confiance avec les mamans, afin de leur offrir un espace de dialogue et de soutien pour partager leurs problèmes et aspirations: relations avec les enfants, vie de famille, santé, émotions, valeur individuelle.

Dans notre culture, les mamans sont l'influence principale pour promouvoir l'auto-estime de leurs enfants et ouvrir le monde devant eux... ou pas.

Nous pouvons créer cet espace de soutien en établissant un contact avec les familles de l'intérieur, en intégrant leurs enfants à notre Centre et nos événements.

Faites une donation! Même 10$ peuvent faire une différence pour l'avenir d'un tout petit!

Si vous ne pouvez pas faire de contributions financière, nous serons heureux si vous pouvez faire passer ce message parmi vos connaissances!

Nous sommes reconnaissants aussi pour les donations de matériels, de livres (en français et anglais aussi!), des déguisements; nous offrons aussi des opportunités de volontariat et de parrainage.

Depuis le coeur de la forêt tropicale d'Equateur,

MERCI!
story_txt:
(Français en dessous)El Manantial Mindo
Hello, my name is Genny, I was born in the highlands of
Ecuador 41 years ago. I was fortunate enough that my parents
supported me in working hard at school, which eventually lead me to
obtain a scholarship for college education in Europe. There, I
experienced first hand what it is to have so many doors open thanks
to a good education, but above all thanks to the awareness that
everyone has the right and the capacity to pursue their own dreams.
El Manantial educational center was built starting
March 2014, by 12 families, 15 children, 3 guides and many friends. So
far all has been funded with the effort, time, and money brought in
by the families. Now, it is time to open the project to others!
The driving idea of our project, is to provide
our children and the local community with an education alternative
based on respect, creativity, freedom and an overall healthy and
supportive evironment for their unlimited development - for boys AND
girls.
We use active education methods and materials
(Montessori, alternative) and prepared environments to open as many
possibilities in the minds and spirits of the children.  We also
support practical learning with activities and experiences involving
nature and the day to day of the local community. 

Mindo is afterall a birdwatching paradise and
mega-diverse natural spot, but it is also a village where half of the
population lives under the poverty threshold, alcoolism and domestic
violence and abuse are rampant, and lots remains to be done in terms
of infrastructure, health and above all, education.
Your support
will help us to promote within the community the
concepts of:
quality education (as opposed to learning by heart and complying to rules)
equality for little girls (often relegated to household chores, and discouraged from pursuing their development)
respect and collaboration
individual initiative and responsibility
environmental awareness
integral health awareness (mind, body, nutrition, women's health)

What do we need?
Needs are neverending of course :) but these
are our priorities for the school year starting April 2015:

5 full scholarships for local children with no resources 9.000$
Maintenance and building 1.200$ (build an additional room for the 8-10 year olds, repair the thatch roof of the communal space for the little ones)
Making and purchasing of learning materials 800$
Organize events and workshops to promote integral education within the local community 4.000$. 

Children are a crucial door to families and
especially to mothers here in Ecuador. Babies and toddlers are
cherished, but soon the demands of large families and few resources
pile up the responsibilities and hard work on very young kids. We
want to build a trusting relationship with the town mothers, so that
they find a space with us to talk about their problems: parenting,
family life, health, self-worth.In our culture, mothers are the
main influence who promote self-esteem and open the world to their
children... or not.We believe we can create this safe and
supportive space from within, starting with the children, by way of
integrating them to our Center and to our community events.Please donate! Even 10$ can make a difference for the future of a little one!If
you cannot contribute financially, we are more than happy if you help
us spreading the word about our project! We also welcome
donations of learning materials, books (in french and english too!),
costumes, and we offer volunteer and sponsorship opportunities.
From the heart of the cloud forest of Ecuador,
THANK YOU!*******************************************

 
El Manantial
Mindo
Je m'appelle Genny, je suis née en Equateur, sur
les hauts-plateaux des Andes il y a 41 ans. J'ai eu la chace d'avoir
des parents qui m'ont soutenue dans mes étides, ce qui m'a permis
d'obtenir une bourse pour mes études supérieures en Europe. C'est
là que j'ai pu fair l'expérience de ce que cela signifie de voir
les portes s'ouvrir grâce à une bonne éducation, mais surtout
grâce au fait de savoir que toute personne à le droit et la
capacité de poursuivre ses idéaux.
Le centre d'éducation El Manantial s'est
construit en May 2014, avec l'effort, le temps et l'argent de 12
familles, 15 enfants, 3 guides et beaucoup d'amis. Maintenant, il est
temps de s'ouvrir au reste de la communauté!
L'idée moteur de ce projet est d'offrir aux
enfants de la communauté locale une éducation alternative basée
sur le respect, la créativité, la liberté, et surtout sur la base
d'une environnement sain qui encourage un développement illimité –
pour garçons ET filles.
Nous utilisons des méthodes et des matériels
actifs (Montessori, alternatifs) et des environnments préparés pour
ouvrir autant de possibilités intellectuelles et viventielles que
possible. Nous encourageons aussi l'apprentissage pratique avec des
activités et des expériences dans la nature et dans le jour le jour
de la communauté.
Mindo est après tout un paradis des amateurs
d'oiseaux et un endroit connu pour sa méga-diversité naturelle,
mais c'est aussi un village où la moitié de la population vit en
dessous du seuil de pauvreté, où l'alcoholisme et la violence et
l'abus domestiques sont courants; tant reste à faire au niveau des
infrastructures, de la santé et surtout de l'éducation.
Votre soutien
Nous aidera à promouvoir dans la communauté les
concepts suivants:
éducation de qualité (à l'opposé de la mémorisation et de se soumettre à des règlements arbitraires)
égalité pour les petites (et plus grandes) filles (souvent souscrites aux tâches ménagères, et trouvant des obstacles pour poursuivre leur développement)
respect et collaboration
initiative et responsibilité individuelle
conscience des enjeux écologiques
conscience de la santé personnelle et familiale (connaissances, conscience corporelle, nutrition, santé féminine)

De quoi avons-nous besoin?
Il y a toujours des nouveaux besoins bien-sûr :)
mais voici nos priorités pour l'année scolaire qui commence en
Avril 2015:

5 bourses complètes pour des enfants sans resources 9.000$
Entretien et construction 1.200$ (constructioin d'une nouvelle salle pour les grands 8-10 ans, réparation du toit de chaume de l'espace communal des petits)
Fabrication et achat de matériels d'apprentissage 800$
Organisation d'événements et ateliers pour promouvoir l'éducation intégrale dans la communauté locale 4.000$.
Les enfants sont une porte dans la vie des
familles, et en particulier une connexion avec les mamans ici en
Equateur. Les bébés et les petits enfants sont adorés, mais
malheureusement bientôt les responsabilités et le travail
qu'exigent les familles nombreuses et le peu de ressources,
s'entassent sur les épaules des enfants.
Nous cherchons à construire une relation de
confiance avec les mamans, afin de leur offrir un espace de dialogue
et de soutien pour partager leurs problèmes et aspirations:
relations avec les enfants, vie de famille, santé, émotions, valeur
individuelle.
Dans notre culture, les mamans sont l'influence
principale pour promouvoir l'auto-estime de leurs enfants et ouvrir
le monde devant eux... ou pas.Nous pouvons créer cet
espace de soutien en établissant un contact avec les familles de
l'intérieur, en intégrant leurs enfants à notre Centre et nos
événements.
Faites une donation! Même 10$ peuvent faire une différence pour l'avenir d'un tout petit!Si vous ne pouvez pas faire de contributions
financière, nous serons heureux si vous pouvez faire passer ce
message parmi vos connaissances!Nous sommes reconnaissants
aussi pour les donations de matériels, de livres (en français et
anglais aussi!), des déguisements; nous offrons aussi des
opportunités de volontariat et de parrainage.
Depuis le coeur de la forêt tropicale
d'Equateur,
MERCI!

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for taking the time to read up on the Life Training Campus.  We have a varied background of talents and skills.  Everything we have and have done has led us to this grand adventure.  Our students are going to have more fun than they thought possible at the campus.  They can also invite their friends and family to join them almost anytime for free.  If you are like us, you understand where things are heading in this world and you aren't going to let it happen... not on OUR watch!  If we  work together, we can turn it all around!  Everything you know, the mistakes you've made, the victories you've had... all lead up to a wealth of information that you wish you would have known growing up. Part of each student's training will be to find out what their local community needs and put a team together for community service projects!  Hands on in the local communities is what we are all about.  Well let's take ALL the best information and feed it into the next generation.  Let us raise up such a collection of leaders that we shake the world!  

What We Need & What You Get

We purchased two facilities over a year ago and they were in great shape.  They sat vacant for over 14 years without incident.  Then record snowfall caused enormous water damage at the main campus at Froebel School.  The project went from being ready to open to millions of dollars in needed repairs overnight.  A setback yes, but we love the old building and structurally she is sound.  So we are hoping to open for this fall's school year, but we will need help. 

A detailed list of building/repair/updating costs is as follows: 

         REPAIRS AND REFURBISHMENT

  • New roof for gymnasium and boiler room                                                      
  • hallway/ceiling repairs                                                                                          
  • gymnasium floor                                                                                                     
  • kitchen area refurbish                                                                                           
  • refurbish pizzeria and ice cream parlor                                                          
  • locker room rebuild medical/rehab center                                                   
  • repair front roof of building                                                                                 
  • replace hardware in fixtures                                                                               
  • replace flooring and carpet                                                                                
  • scrape and paint walls                                                                                          $332,125 GROUNDS AND EQUIPMENT                                                                                       
  • scrubbers, vacuums and cleaning equipment  
  • lawn mowing and snow removal equipment
  • transport vehicles/buses for the students/elderly/community 
  • workout equipment
  • sports equipment
  • recreational equipment/rock climbing wall                                                  $509,705 UPDATES AND ENGINEERING
  • engineering/architecture plans and blueprints 
  • parking lot and placement of aggregates                                                     
  • office equipment - computers/telephones/copiers                                 
  • security system - cameras, pass cards, alarms, lighting                         
  • city water vault with tap lines, valves and piping                                        $432,780 GOING GREEN
  • energy efficient windows 
  • solar panels
  • diesel backup generator
  • battery storage units
  • wind generators
  • power panel upgrades 
  • energy efficient heating/cooling units
  • hydroponic garden/greenhouse                                                                      $616,250 STARTUP COSTS                                                                         
  • employee startup wages for 3 months  (17 employees)                          $130,560                        
  •                                                                                                                                 ************                                                                               
  • Total cost of renovation:                                                                                 $2,021,420

Please check our perks for anyone who contributes to the fundraiser.  We want you to be involved with us forever!  Not just one donation and done.  Donate and you are part of the family.  Get involved and you will find out that this will be the thing that starts the Dominoes of Destiny!  You get a fantastic gift for helping save the world AND you can visit us at any of our campuses worldwide with your entire family!  We would love to have you.

Of course the money we are hoping for covers everything we need... but any help is appreciated.  We will eventually make this happen with no help, but we would love to open up for this year's students. Our goal is to go green energy and do this right the FIRST time!  If we only go part of the way now, it will cost 3X as much to put it together a little at a time.  Any money below the dream amount will go to just the basics of opening up the campus. 

The Impact

The Life Training Campus and our Muskegon location is just Phase One.  As this facility begins to run smoothly, we start another... and then another.  The world needs leadership almost as much as it needs air right now.  Join us in this battle.  Bishop Tom Omukhobero from Kenya flew in from Nairobi just to meet us in person after he had seen some of the material we will be using at the campus.  This is exactly what he wanted for his church leaders and the orphans.  He used the last of his bank account for the flight and we made sure his trip would be worth it.  Bishop Tom didn't want a handout for his people, he wanted leadership training so he could end the cycle of poverty in Kenya.  We began "One Tribe" and things are rolling in Africa, let's get America going.  Leaders are needed everywhere from the presidency to your family.  Let's have fun and do it together.  

Risks & Challenges

The risks are few, the challenges many... Getting the building up to code again is going to take some money.  Mr. Joseph LaMie and his construction background, along with his business contacts, make this all possible.  We love our local community and know you love yours as well.  Let's start locally and build from there.  When we finish this project, let us know which community you think we should help next.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have any money to donate at this time, visit our website and contribute later.  Or, tell everyone you can using the Indiegogo website.  Help us build leaders out of our students at any age.  

   www.lifetrainingcampus.org

story:
Short Summary

In many parts of the world, girls face serious challenges including poverty, sexism, and harassment that prevent them from receiving an education.Tanzania is no exception. Despite these barriers, many girls desperately want the opportunity to complete secondary school and create better lives for themselves and their families.
Rachel Hagues and Hunter Parker initially began traveling to the island of Ukerewe in Tanzania in graduate school to conduct a service-learning program with adolescent girls. The harsh realities they observed, coupled with their passion for justice compelled them to continue working with the girls and several local ladies that had become their friends. After many years, one dissertation, much prayer, and several trips later, they recently began taking steps towards establishing a boarding school which they hope will bring lasting change. Thanks to the efforts of local people, they helped establish a committee of supportive leaders on the island and were given thirteen acres of land for the school by the African Inland Church - Tanzania (AICT): Mara and Ukerewe Church.
Tumaini Jipya (which means 'New Hope' in Swahili) Secondary School for Girls will be built in a central location on the island adjacent to several churches and medical clinic with electricity and water available. The school, when it opens, will begin with Form 1 students (comparable to 9th grade in the United States) and grades will be added in phases with approximately fifty girls being selected each year, coming from all parts of the island district, with varying socioeconomic and religious backgrounds.
More details and background on the project can be found at http://rockintl.org/index.php/projects/rockids-.... 


What We Need

One Hope Church, a small family who loves Jesus and loves people and is based in Athens, GA, has committed to starting funding by raising the money required to build the first classroom ($15,000) for the school, but we need your help!

For Spring of 2015 (February-May), we will be hosting and sponsoring local percentage nights, service events, theme and activity nights, and church collections among other things to help bring in funds. We invite you to participate if you are in the Athens area. 

When you contribute, you will be giving a tax-deductible donation to ROCK International, a nonprofit whose mission is to provide relief, opportunity and care for kids while being concerned with their earthly and eternal futures and those of people in their communities. 

DISCLAIMER: The funds raised through this campaign will be channeled through ROCK International, a 501c3 nonprofit (www.rockintl.org). The campaign does not necessarily reflect the views of the nonprofit or have any formal association with it. All contributions are considered unrestricted gifts and can't be specified for any particular purpose. Though this fundraising effort is approved by the ROCK board, it is not generated by ROCK Int. 

Beyond the $15,000 for the classroom, this year's estimation for the project is $250,000. This figure represents the cost of the school's Construction Phase 1 which at its completion will be comprised of 2 classrooms and science laboratories, dining facilities, a garden for food cultivation and learning purposes, dormitories and hygiene facilities with electricity and running water, administration offices and a staff room. Future construction projects will bring additions to current structures, such as more classrooms and housing as well as a recreational area and an area for meetings and performances. 

All funds raised will go towards construction even if we do not reach our entire goal. Funds raised outside of the campaign will go towards the project though they are not reflected here. 


The Impact

The school will be a safe place for local girls to learn where they will be supported by caring female faculty. The vision for the Tumaini Jipya Secondary Girls’ School is that every pupil has the opportunity to receive a high-quality education, free of abuse and injustice, in a Christ honoring atmosphere that allows them to thrive. Foundational to the mission of the school is the longing to show these girls that they are deeply loved and were created by God for a purpose. Our prayer is that this school will serve as a conduit for them to learn truth, discover their inherent value, and that the results will be eternally lasting.


Risks & Challenges

Along with creating this school we are establishing a non-profit in Tanzania. Non-profit status is instrumental in integrating the school into the national system of education. The school can begin operation without the full establishment of the non-profit, but our goal is to have the logistics of creating the NPO go as smoothly and quickly as possible.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the word about this project is very helpful to our cause! The more people that know about this effort, the more potential we have to put resources towards it. 

We also ask that you please join us in prayer throughout the whole process. We want to keep in mind the reason we are engaging in trying to help these girls and remember the source of our inspiration and resources.

Tumaini Jipya (which means 'New Hope' in Swahili) Secondary School for Girls will be built in a central location on the island adjacent to several churches and medical clinic with electricity and water available. The school, when it opens, will begin with Form 1 students (comparable to 9th grade in the United States) and grades will be added in phases with approximately fifty girls being selected each year, coming from all parts of the island district, with varying socioeconomic and religious backgrounds.More details and background on the project can be found at http://rockintl.org/index.php/projects/rockids-....   
What We Need One Hope Church, a small family who loves Jesus and loves people and is based in Athens, GA, has committed to starting funding by raising the money required to build the first classroom ($15,000) for the school, but we need your help!
For Spring of 2015 (February-May), we will be hosting and sponsoring local percentage nights, service events, theme and activity nights, and church collections among other things to help bring in funds. We invite you to participate if you are in the Athens area. 
When you contribute, you will be giving a tax-deductible donation to ROCK International, a nonprofit whose mission is to provide relief, opportunity and care for kids while being concerned with their earthly and eternal futures and those of people in their communities. 
DISCLAIMER: The funds raised through this campaign will be channeled through ROCK International, a 501c3 nonprofit (www.rockintl.org). The campaign does not necessarily reflect the views of the nonprofit or have any formal association with it. All contributions are considered unrestricted gifts and can't be specified for any particular purpose. Though this fundraising effort is approved by the ROCK board, it is not generated by ROCK Int. 
Beyond the $15,000 for the classroom, this year's estimation for the project is $250,000. This figure represents the cost of the school's Construction Phase 1 which at its completion will be comprised of 2 classrooms and science laboratories, dining facilities, a garden for food cultivation and learning purposes, dormitories and hygiene facilities with electricity and running water, administration offices and a staff room. Future construction projects will bring additions to current structures, such as more classrooms and housing as well as a recreational area and an area for meetings and performances. 
All funds raised will go towards construction even if we do not reach our entire goal. Funds raised outside of the campaign will go towards the project though they are not reflected here.    
The Impact The school will be a safe place for local girls to learn where they will be supported by caring female faculty. The vision for the Tumaini Jipya Secondary Girls’ School is that every pupil has the opportunity to receive a high-quality education, free of abuse and injustice, in a Christ honoring atmosphere that allows them to thrive. Foundational to the mission of the school is the longing to show these girls that they are deeply loved and were created by God for a purpose. Our prayer is that this school will serve as a conduit for them to learn truth, discover their inherent value, and that the results will be eternally lasting.   
Risks & Challenges Along with creating this school we are establishing a non-profit in Tanzania. Non-profit status is instrumental in integrating the school into the national system of education. The school can begin operation without the full establishment of the non-profit, but our goal is to have the logistics of creating the NPO go as smoothly and quickly as possible.  
    
Other Ways You Can Help Spreading the word about this project is very helpful to our cause! The more people that know about this effort, the more potential we have to put resources towards it. 
We also ask that you please join us in prayer throughout the whole process. We want to keep in mind the reason we are engaging in trying to help these girls and remember the source of our inspiration and resources.

story:
Who We Are

Epitome of Soul is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization focused on equipping, empowering and encouraging leadership in high school students.  Utilizing the arts as a means to develop and foster life-long skills, Epitome of Soul exposes urban community students to theater, creative writing, music and dance for example, as well as assistance to achieve academic excellence.  To date, Epitome of Soul has had tremendous success and impacted the lives of many.  

We encourage you to check out the website epitomeofsoul.org to view some of the programs and students in action.

How You Help

As Epitome of Soul reaches its third year of operation, it is an exciting time to be a part of this growth and to help make an even greater impact on the community. With your help Epitome of Soul can achieve it’s Indiegogo fundraising goal, increasing awareness of its mission and raising funds to propel organizational growth.

Your contribution today will go toward one or more of Epitome of Soul’s three key programs:  Educational Advocacy, Mentorship, and Scholarship.  Each program is tailored to aid in the advancement of high school students in urban communities. Click here for further information on these programs.

The magnitude of our organizational goals extend far beyond this crowdfunding campaign.  Your contribution in helping achieve this fundraising goal not only helps with this project, but helps to springboard Epitome of Soul forward into a greater capacity to fully execute its mission.
You can give at any level that you'd like.  We have some pretty cool perks that would look great on you! Check them out on the right.

Students participating in a creative process exercise at the 2015 Arts Symposium.

The Impact

Here’s how you can make an impact when you help us achieve our goal…

You can be confident in your contribution to Epitome of Soul. Based on the planning and professional experience of the Executive team and Board, and execution of previous programs, you can trust that your contribution will be used solely for the advancement of students through arts programming and cultural development activities.  Below is a breakdown of how funds will be allocated:

  • $8,880 goes toward the Art Symposium series and master class which falls under the Educational Advocacy Program and entails a 3 workshops/ 1 master class series that will be held in the spring of 2016.  Each class focuses on an individual arts discipline in the areas of music,theatre,writing and filmmaking, and will be instructed by an experienced industry professional.

  • $3,120 goes toward development of the Epitome of Soul Mentorship Program (ESMP).  Contributions provide materials such as journals, books, materials needed for each art discipline and backpacks for the founding ESMP class. This will also cover a portion of the honorarium costs for industry workshop leaders.

  • $3,000 awards 3 deserving high school seniors who have applied for the Keys of Success and Music is Life Scholarships to further their education at an accredited institution.
Epitome of Soul’s work is valuable to the community because of its commitment to developing more leaders in the arts and in society.  US Secretary of Education Arne Duncan said,“The arts can help students become tenacious, team-oriented problem solvers who are able to think creatively. These qualities can be especially important in improving learning among students from economically disadvantaged circumstances." It is imperative that students within these areas have access to arts programs, despite the budget cuts that have occurred in many of their school districts. The programming that is provided to high school students and the community is designed to achieve a primary initiative, which is to organize youth groups to undertake projects that benefit the community and encourage leadership, character, compassion and good citizenship.

Here are a few highlights and accomplishments to which previous community contributions have played a part:

  • Execution of over 7 programs and workshops with international and local artists, with close to 200 students in attendance.

  • Award-winning non-profit having received the 2014 Mayor of Paterson’s Award for Civic Engagement and the Rotary Club’s 2014 Patersonians Making a Difference Beneficiary Award

  • Student testimonial: “They’re [Epitome of Soul] very encouraging, I want to be able to give back to my community and be like them when I grow up.”-Autumn 

Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond money- we need your help spreading the word

We understand that some people are unable to contribute, but there other ways you can help:

  • Share this campaign with at least 3 friends or family members and ask for their support.

  • Post this campaign to your social media pages with this copy: "Can you imagine a world without art? Help @epitomeofsoul_  keep the arts in our schools by contributing here! #ESArtsLeaders"

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools below!

  • Volunteer your time at an Epitome of Soul program or event by emailing your contact information to info@epitomeofsoul.org.  Let us know how you’d like to help and we’ll get back to you soon.


Frequently Asked Questions

  • Are you a non-profit? Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?               Yes, Epitome of Soul is a public 501(c)(3) non-profit organization under tax-id # 45-5496564. Contributions made to Epitome of Soul are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

  • How can I receive a tax-deductible receipt?                                                             When you contribute, Indiegogo's nonprofit payment processor First Giving, will send you an email confirming your contribution. For all contributions over $100, you will receive an official receipt for tax-reporting purposes by email after the campaign ends.                                                             .

  • Where can I learn more about what your supporters think about the organization?                                                                                                                         You can visit our Great Nonprofits page at  http://greatnonprofits.org/org/epitome-of-soul-inc to view supporter reviews and feedback from previous programs and events.

  • Can I donate from outside the USA?                                                                              Yes! You can access our website epitomeofsoul.org and Indiegogo campaign from anywhere online.  Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, not bank or debit cards-so the best way to donate internationally is with a credit card.

  • What payment methods do you accept?                                                            Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.

  • If I have more questions, who do I ask?                                                                       Send us an email at info@epitomeofsoul.org and we'll get back to you as soon as we can.

story:
As this campaign is now closed on Indigogo you can visit our Facebook site to purchase the perks that are left over. Please go to The Children's Garden Exeter

We have raised enough money to keep us going till the end of the Spring term but we need to raise more.

We have had a shortfall in funding, caused by local government bureaucracy. With more children due to attend in Spring, the future of the school looks good. But it will close before that time comes without your help now. 

If that happens, we will lose the only early years Steiner centre in this part of Devon. As a parent with two children at the school, I can say there is nowhere nearby quite like this. It is a beautiful space offering our children a truly special environment, and it's run by dedicated, talented and highly experienced teachers. Please take a look around our Facebook page to see how wonderful it is - The Children's Garden Exeter

We have more children due to start before and after Easter, and any money you donate will be used to help make sure the school is still there when they arrive. 

If you think you can help, you can donate money directly or buy one of our special gifts (see right). 

Thank you so much for reading this. Please help.
