story:
Help me Tell Entrepreneurs What They Need to Succeed.

50% of All Startup Businesses Fail in Their First Year!!!                                      Because They Do Not Understand Practical Business Principles.

75% of All New Businesses Fail By Year Three!!!                                               Because They Do Not Execute Business Plans Based on Business Principle. 

My Book  Teaches Entrepreneurs Specific, Usable, Business Principles.        You can Help Vets. Start, Operate, Promote, Buy, and Sell a Business.

Principles that Entrepreneurs Need to Find Opportunities and Avoid Failure.  Principles they need to Finance, Promote, and Grow a Profitable Company.

When new vets and entrepreneurs start a business they don't realize how many moving parts they must coordinate in order to be profitable. They need a principle-based business plan. Help my book teach how to  recognize opportunities, Avoid Problems by increasing circulation.  If they know and execute the 102 Practical Business Principles presented in the Third Edition of Entrepreneurial SUCCESS they will succeed. Vets will learn to systematic way of solving problems, and a foolproof way to hire good people. You will find principles to write ad copy, then develop and execute an advertising campaign.  Entrepreneurs will learn the principles for writing a business plan, how to create a Cash Flow Forecast, and predicts how much cash they will need to fund their business. Learn how to write a contract that will keep you out of court, and the principles for buying and selling a business. 

"The Road to the Top" Is Easier When Guided by Practical Business Principles


Meet the Author

Joe Geiger has spent over 60 years as an entrepreneur, starting, building and promoting eleven businesses, two of which, Orca Yachts LLC, and Performance Aircraft, Inc., each employed over 120 people. Performance Aircraft operated four locations in three western states. He financed several personally. Automatic Chef Inc. was financed with the help of a supplier. Two with stockholders and Orca Yachts LLC was financed with a 5 million dollar, two stage, self-directed regulation “D” public stock offering, which he personally wrote and sold. While working for a friend's company he designed and implemented a multi-media sales program that doubled the company’s sales in one year. In the fall of 2009, he started teaching college Entrepreneurship and Small Business Management. While teaching, he wrote the book Entrepreneurial SUCCESS, 101 Business Principles, The Road to the Top.

"In the spring of 2011, Geiger published the book Entrepreneurial SUCCESS, 101 Business Principles, The Road to the Top. A Second Edition was printed one year later. With 64 additional pages, these 102 Business Principles, in the 300+ page Third Edition will be published in August 2015. You can help teach Veterans and entrepreneurs Real-World Business Principles that are better than any college degree. These principles teach business planning, solve business problems, highlight opportunities, facilitate growth, organize promotion, and increase profitability.           Every Business Person Needs to Read This Book."

Gerald Quirk, Lt. Col. Ret.                                                                                     Professor, Lecturer, Business Turn-around Specialist

The first two editions sold well, but the book needs National Exposure.


To date "Entrepreneurial SUCCESS" has been used at five Colleges:

University of Colorado, Denver School of Business

University of Richmond

John Tyler College

J. Sargeant Reynolds College

Germanna College


"Entrepreneurial SUCCESS" is available at:

Amazon.com

TheRoadToTheTop.com (Autographed Copies)

Help the Campaign's Goal!  Raise the Funds to:

Greatly Expand the Book’s National Exposure By:

     Creating a Publicity Campaign

     Financing a National Advertising Campaign

     Promoting and increasing the Book's Availability in National Book Stores

You can Help Veterans and Entrepreneurs Build Businesses Nation-Wide

The 102 Business Principles will help entrepreneurs, including Indiegogo campaigners, grow business opportunities, avoid mistakes, and create jobs. 

"Entrepreneurial SUCCESS" is not a book of untested theories. The 102 Principles have been successfully used for years by many different companies.    These Principles Work.


     Orca Yacht LLC - The Yacht That Changed Offshore Sport-fishing Boat Design 
Help Me Help Veterans and Entrepreneurs Create:                                                Jobs and Successful New Businesses,                                                                           Increase the number of Jobs and Profits of Existing Businesses.

Contribute to my Flexible Campaign

story:
Hannah*  is working in the mental health profession and is almost finished with her degree. She works with kids at risk who have suffered trauma and literally saves lives on a daily basis. Working with kids who have been abandoned by society, friends and family. She could have easily walked away in the past but she stood by them and made their world a better place. 

She is recently married. 
Her husband is looking for a job while also attending school, knowing that only an education can lead to a better future. 

Hannah*  needs $15,000 in order to continue and complete the program. She was loaned $5,000 by her brother who cannot truly afford it but found a way.

All together her friends and supporters have raised almost $10,000 knowing that this is not only a worthy charitable cause but an investment for the future. 

She needs  $5,000 more to be able to pay the bill which is due by the end of this week so she can continue the program and graduate and work as a licensed professional.

Maimonides, the great sage once said, "Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day; teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime."

She is learning - please help her continue her education. 

By giving or spreading the word quickly you have a chance to make this world a better place. She has already improved the lives of so many - please help her continue doing this. 

Hannah* has never abandoned the abandoned kids - let us not abandon her in this time of need. 

*Not her real name

story:
Short Summary

We're Reverse Order, an internationally touring rock band  that was a semi-finalist on America's Got Talent. During a tour of high schools in 2012 we met many students who were struggling with bullying, self-harming, and even some who had attempted, or were contemplating, suicide. While  these students were confiding in us we realized many of their struggles were things that we had all dealt with in our own lives and we felt a very real need to reach out to these students, as well as the ones who were too afraid to speak up.

We developed the Reverse The Trend anti-bullying program to show students of all ages that they are not alone, they will overcome, and that life is beautiful. Over the past year, we have been able to share our own experiences with tens of thousands of students in a powerful and interactive way, which leaves them with the tools to find their passion and overcome the obstacles in their lives in a safe and positive way.

Your contributions will allow us to bring Reverse The Trend to more than 150 schools in the upcoming school year and help us prevent bullying and bullying related suicides all over the US.

What We Need

As of right now we have over 150 school assemblies booked for next school year and many more schools who want to bring the program to their students. In order to get to these schools and inspire these students we need to raise at least $20,000. This money will go towards:

  • Gas and Vehicle Maintenance- So we can get to each school all over the US.
  • Accommodations- When we are away from home.
  • Educational Materials- We leave with the students so they can reach out to us.
Based on our expenses this past year the estimated costs are about $9,000 for gas and vehicle maintenance, $8,000 for accommodations, and $3,000 for educational materials. All of the contributions Reverse The Trend receives go directly to bringing the program to students and making sure we have the tools to educate them.  No donations pay any salaries or personal expenses. This fundraiser is 100% for the students!

What You Get

As a part of this fundraising campaign we are giving away awesome perks as our way of saying thank you for supporting Reverse The Trend.

We have exclusive rewards, from thank you phone calls and unreleased music, all the way up to an on the road tour experience with us where you can see the students you're helping first hand! We also have rewards like shirts, photos, and patches that are totally exclusive to this campaign so you can show your support for this worthy cause. Finally we have some very limited prizes that are Reverse Order originals for you to get your hands on, like props from music videos and even our original banner! (Scroll down to see all of the great items!)

The Impact

We began bringing our Reverse The Trend program to schools in 2012. After each performance we received numerous letters about the impact we were having. Over the next 2 years the program was requested at more schools as word about its success spread amongst parents and teachers. All this time we were adjusting and perfecting the program to what it has become today.

Reverse The Trend combines popular music, personal stories, and tried and tested teaching tools to educate students in an exciting, engaging performance that will inspire them to set goals and overcome the challenges in their own lives. We believe that the reason Reverse The Trend has been so successful is the unique approach we take that is unlike any other school assembly you have ever seen.

Just a few examples of Reverse The Trends success:

  • Since 2014 Reverse The Trend is now available in schools and outreach programs nationwide through out the school year.
  • We have presented the program at over 275 schools in 33 states.
  • Reports of bullying have decreased up to 85% in schools we have visited.

And here are some quotes from teachers and parents that have experienced a Reverse The Trend assembly:

"You came to my children's school yesterday and you were amazing! You were very inspirational. The kids and teachers really seemed to enjoy it. You could really feel the energy in the room. You each told a story about bullying and the kids listened! Who better to send a message to our children than a cool kids rock band? At the end of the assembly we asked the kids what they had learned from Reverse Order and the kids answers were almost verbatim, which showed they got it! They heard your message! Please keep up the great work!" - Parent from Franklin Lakes Elementary School

“Five teachers came to us within two minutes of the end of the performance to rave about how wonderful the message was and how fabulous the overall music was! I would definitely recommend Reverse Order to anyone! Thanks so much for a great experience.” – Sue Ponente, Guidance Counselor, Doylestown, PA

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to contributing please share our message and our goal with your friends, family, and anyone else you may know who may feel strongly about what we are accomplishing. Word of mouth is one of the biggest assets a small non-profit like ours can use. We truly appreciate all of your support in this effort and we know its people like you who will make this program an even greater success!

And don't forget about IndieGoGo's awesome sharing tools for Facebook, Twitter, and everywhere else... Get the word out!

story:
We are a Scout Group from Greece. Our group is many years located in an unsuitable building for our activities. It has no space, a small amount of sun and we pay rent . The landlord asked to increase the rent . So counting from the begining all the costs (electricity,water,telephone,rent) , we saw that it difficult to cope and that endangers our club. We would like to find and move to a more suitable space for children and a space that we can afford but we need YOUR help for that!


   

                   Children need  sun and space to express themshelves  

  The first thing to consider is the physical space of the area. The design and layout of the club affect how children interact and how safe and connected they feel in the  space. Do children have room to move ? Is the circle time area large enough for children to cross their legs, or are they clustered together with little room to move?  For example, children with attention deficit disorders and Asperger’s syndrome are sensitive to how space is used and often need quiet areas to work. There should be space set aside from the other children where they are able to feel their space is respected.  With this in mind it is also important to remember that all health and safety issues should address the children’s emotional, cognitive, language, and social skills.                          


                                             

Scouting complements the school and the family, filling needs not met by either. Scouting develops self-knowledge and the need to explore, to discover, and to want to know. Scouts discover the world beyond the classroom, tapping the skills of others to learn and to become well-rounded people. 

Through recreation, Scouting achieves its purpose of helping young people develop physically, intellectually, socially, and spiritually. Scouting is all about building confidence and self-esteem, learning important life skills and leadership skills, team building, outdoor adventure, education, and fun! Scouts learn how to make good choices and to take responsibility for their actions so that they are prepared for their adult life as independent persons.

                      


There are Scout associations and branches in more than 216 countries and territories. Scouting has never stopped growing since its founding in 1907. Today there are more than 25 million Scouts. Over 300 million people have been members in the more than 90 years since Scouting was founded. While Scouting is adapted to local needs and culture, its Purpose, Principles, and Method are the same world wide.

story:
Who are we?

TReND in Africa - an international charity for sustainable development through higher education and scientific innovation.

Andrew - a scientist living in rural Mozambique with a love of teaching, writing and presenting, and a volunteer for TReND.

What is this course about?

The African research scene is improving. Year on year the number of papers produced by, or in collaboration with, African scientists is increasing – from 1996 to 2012 the number of research papers published in scientific journals with at least one African author more than quadrupled.

However, much research remains unpublished for instance in institutional journals or published in regional journals that are not yet indexed in international journal databases. The major problem is not that research from Africa is not produced in significant quantity but that it is not always being recognised at the level is it due.

TReND in Africa believe that true sustainable development can only come through investment in higher education and scientific innovation. We run a wide range of educational activities making use of latest technologies and developments, ranging from open source software and hardware approaches such as 3D printing to online teaching tools. 

A workshop in Science Writing and Communication contributes to scientific development in its overarching training goal - to improve scientific literacy and access to internationally recognised journals and to improve the standards of African journals. Hosted by Chancellor College, University of Malawi in Zomba, the six day course from 7th to the 12th September will train participants in all aspects of communication in science - from effectively searching the literature to review the field, planning and writing manuscripts targeted to appropriate journals and responding to reviewers, to giving talks, not only to peers in an academic setting, but also in public and with non specialist audiences so that scientists can share their work with the wider society. We will encourage the participants to embrace the role social media can play in their science, guiding them in a truly 21st century approach to scientific research.

What we need and how you can help

A contribution to this course will go a long way to supporting early career researchers from all over Africa progress in their contribution to African innovation and research. 

Firstly, what is free:
As usual for TReND courses, attendance is free of charge and the instructors offer their time on a volunteer basis. The host institution, Chancellor College are providing classrooms free of charge. 

Secondly, what funds are required for:
Teaching materials such as flip charts and printing costs, accommodation, travel and refreshments for participants and instructors.

The budget

We are operating a tiered budget which provides different services dependent on funding received. The lower budget for the course is £1,750, which includes accommodation, food and transport for two instructors (one international and one local), day refreshments for 25 students and 2 instructors, printing of materials and internet costs. With more funding the budget can expand to £3,500: this will include accommodation and food for the 25 students in addition to the instructors. An upper tier budget of £6,000 allows for two further international instructors, who will add their expertise from senior research positions.

The impact

The primary impact will be on the participants: early-career researchers from all over Africa. We hope that the skills learnt in the workshop will be taken back to the participants’ universities, for example when they read and review their colleagues’ manuscripts or make comments during presentations. In hosting, Chancellor College will benefit indirectly as attendees mix with Chancellor College staff, allowing the exchange of ideas over the refreshment breaks as at many international science conferences. As part of the interactive side of the workshop, we hope to have the attendees practice their skills learnt in a special departmental series of short talks, to which staff will be invited. The staff will be indirect beneficiaries of the workshop as the attendees present the research using skills learnt.

TReND has 5 years of experience in organising workshops like these - between 2010 and 2014, more than 100 African students took part in TReND programmes in fields such as molecular biology, bioinformatics and neuroscience, using open-source hardware and software. As the primary facilitator, I bring over 7 years of experience in scientific research and communication, with experience in television, museums and the laboratory. Additional facilitators bring further experience in similar fields.

The efforts of TReND are already starting to bear fruit. A 2012 TReND alumnus was selected to attend the Wellcome Trust funded and highly competitive course Computational Molecular Evolution at Cambridge, UK; two 2011 TReND alumni attended the interregional IBRO school on Computational Neuroscience in Hyderabad, India; a further 2011 TReND alumnus worked as a lecturer at Mekelle University (Addis, Ethiopia) and is now pursuing a PhD at the University of Kwazulu-Natal (South Africa) on memory and epilepsy using Drosophila as a model system.

What's the risk?

This is a new course, on a topic that has not yet been addressed by TReND in Africa. As with any new course that is a risk. There is a risk that the interest will be low, but previous courses have been oversubscribed in their first year, and TReND's offerings of workshops and courses has only grown to meet demand. TReND now offers workshops in five areas and has a network of 40 volunteers from Switzerland to Uganda. 

Low funding is also a risk. Though this workshop is low budget in comparison to many scientific workshops, funds are still required for it to go ahead. To reduce the risk of cancellation in the case of insufficient funds, we are operating a tiered budget, where the programme will adjust to meet the level of funding. 

No-show is also a risk - a particular risk to a free-to-attend, international workshop like this. This was a problem in 2012, when three students did not arrive. In response, TReND increased the stringency for selection, only choosing applicants who demonstrate a strong commitment to attending and blacklisting no-shows. This eliminated no-shows and improved the caliber of participant.

Thank you!

Thanks for reading this far. I hope this campaign has interested you and you would like to contribute! If you would like to find out more about the course, please go to our course website. It has more information on the course content, who we're targeting and how we select participants. It'll also be regularly updated.  If you don't want to contribute, please spread the word - TReND is an international charity and loves support from all over the world. Who knows, maybe a Tweet will link us to the pot of money we need!

@TReNDinAfrica; trendinafrica.org; facebook.com/TReNDinAfrica

story:
Our goal is to create educational Multi-Media, videos and Apps, to help deaf Muslims learn about their religion. Muslims in this age of technology have thousands of videos from famous scholars and Apps available to help them to learn about Islam. Deaf Muslims feel left out, neglected and forgotten because they cannot find Islamic videos produced with American Sign Language (ASL). Please help us produce stories and lectures in ASL so deaf Muslims and deaf non-Muslims can learn about our beautiful way of life. 
Our first project is called Stories of the Prophets. These stories will be available on video, through an App, and via eBook. They will teach about the strong faith, exemplary lives, and excellent character of these amazing men who walked this earth. The App will be interactive, breaking down the signs for Islamic terms and ayat from the Quran. We have an excellent team of scholars, writers, interpreters, film producers, illustrators, animators, App developers, and most of all our host Rebecca Hossain who is deaf and will be signing in these productions. 
Our second project will be to add ASL to existing video lectures of one of our beloved local scholars, Shaikh Omar Suleiman. This will allow us to help the deaf community benefit from his teachings, so that they can increase their understanding of Islam and raise their level of Iman, Inshallah. 
Each episode of Stories of the Prophets will cost $10,000 and adding ASL to each 30 min Lecture will cost $5000. This cost will go toward studio rental, filming, editing, illustration, animation, script writing, host, interpreters, DVD duplication, and App/eBook development. Please help us accomplish this goal. Let us all do our part to not leave a single soul out of learning about Islam. 
Professional Good Doers, Inc. is a not for profit organization that will be collecting donations on behalf of National Services for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing (NSDHH) for the production of these multi-media tools for the deaf. www.progooddoers.org, www.nsdhh.org

story:
This is the African Women’s Century! African Ladies who Brunch is a New York City based social society of diaspora women. We meet for brunch to connect, support, and inspire one another.

10 members of African Ladies who Brunch are participating in Mudderella, a 5-mile muddy obstacle course in New York, to raise funds for two nonprofit organizations in Liberia. You can help us support The Franciscan Works Liberian Mission School in Black Tom Town and the More than Me Girls School in Monrovia. Both provide critical schooling and care to children orphaned by the Ebola epidemic and HIV/AIDS. Any contribution to our pledge helps:

  • At Franciscan Works $3 provides meals and education for a child per day. 
  • For More Than Me $4 provides education, health and social services for each girl child per day.

Our pledge is in honor of Johnson Moore, a 17-year-old student from Francesco Works. Sadly Jonathan lost his life to Ebola while caring for his family.

Help us support the education of these children by supporting the African Ladies who Brunch's pledge to complete the Mudderella obstacle course. 


This pledge has been featured on:


The African Ladies who Brunch

The African Ladies who Brunch are a New York City based social society of diaspora women. We meet for brunch to connect, support, and inspire one another. 

Friends, students and colleagues, we are a diverse group of women from all over the continent and the diaspora that are based in around New York:

  • We connect and support each other on our journeys of success. 
  • Each events features a special invited guest, a woman of recognized accomplishment, to join us and inspire. 

This is the African Women’s Century! Our monthly events also support Africa-owned restaurants in the Tri-State area. 


The Liberian Organizations 

Help us support The Francesco Works Liberian Mission School in Black Tom Town and the More than Me Girls School in Monrovia.

More Than Me Girls Academy is on a mission to make sure education and opportunity, not exploitation and poverty, define the lives of the most vulnerable girls from the West Point Slum of Liberia. When she graduates, she will decide what comes next for her life.

  • The More Than Me Academy is the first tuition-free, all girls school in Liberia.
  • The organisation provides these girls an education, two hearty meals a day, access to healthcare, access to a computer lab and library, and a robust afterschool program.
  • Ensuring the girls are off the street for the entire day from 7am to 5pm.

Franciscan Works Liberian Mission School located in West Africa, Liberia Mission is a community of love, learning, work and prayer, providing education, life-skills, faith-formation and opportunity to 400 children and youth.

With your support, a child in the residential program at Liberia Mission will receive a loving home, nutritious food, clothing, medical care, and a first-rate education.


The Mudderella Obstacle Course

Mudderella - Own Your Strong® - are world class, 5–7 mile long, muddy obstacle courses designed by women. Ten members of African Ladies who Brunch are participating in the New York/New Jersey Mudderella Event on May 9th, 2015.

“Own Your Strong” is about empowering women to take pride in their strength – inside and out. Lots of women are strong in different ways.

Our Mudderella team - Team Afrodities!


In Memory of Johnson Moore

Our pledge is in honor of Johnson Moore, a 17-year-old student from Franciscan Works. Sadly Jonathan lost his life to Ebola while caring for his family.


Special Thanks 
Will Denselow, Tamerra Griffin, Chika Okoli, Saran Kaba Jones, Lenox Saphire, Merrill C. Kenna, Emily Bell, Athena and Kianta of fitforeverybody.co

Footage Credit
Feature Story News, Emma Cheppy, Chika Okoli, Francesco Works, and More than Me Girls Academy

story:
Siw Laurent begun her 3-year MFA equivalent Conservatory program at the renowned Stella Adler Studio of Acting in NYC in 2014, and with your help she will graduate in 2017!

Read bio and references at http://www.siwlaurent.com !


Here is her personal letter:


"DEAR INDIEGOGO EXPLORER,

This training is really something else, and it is changing my life to such an extent that I cannot even fully grasp it. This is beyond having a dream of "becoming an actress".

Growing up, meeting a great deal of suppressive and deeply challenging situations, I found myself 13 years old, determined to study to become a researcher in order to change the school system. My main goal since then have been to assist children in their perception of themselves and their power to be the authority of their own lives. We are served so many fear-based illusions in our upbringing, and there is an immense lack of adults offering guidance on how to actually cultivate a healthy relationship to our own emotions, reactions, sensitivity, powers, potentials and trauma, which we as human beings all experience on one level or another. 

Acting is truly a gateway to humanity's hearts by being the mirror we all need to face, which is in my belief why native cultures around the world have a tradition of some form of acting and performance through storytelling. The medicine-man or woman performed stories that would reflect a situation in the community to bring awareness to the problem and offer wisdom on how to solve it. 

Acting in my eyes is a channel through which I can complete this mission I felt was so strongly given to me throughout my childhood.

The most profound encounters I've had with myself have been through a presence, a nudge, a certain kind of poke, experienced when watching certain actors, artists, performers, - people who are truly dedicated and deeply connected to what they do. Who allow themselves the full experience and expression of what they are. 

What is more powerful... To not preach about it, to not tell people what to do or not to do, not even to try to prove anything, but to simply unfold within oneself, allowing others to be touched by that expression in their own time. I am convinced that I can inspire our youth to realize that it is possible to be the leaders of our own lives by daring to be free in my expression through my acting, singing and performing.


What greater gift can I be given than to enter this tradition! 

I CANNOT IMAGINE ANYTHING GREATER, MORE PROFOUND, HEALING AND EFFECTIVE.


Helping me to continue my studies, you are not only giving me a chance to fulfill my dream, you are planting seeds of arms that will grow so that I may reach every child on my journey, being a proof of the worth and abilities each and every one is born with. 


With all my heart I thank you for reading this,

Siw Laurent"


All she needs is one thousand people giving 30$ each, and we believe she will make it! 

(See photos for estimated budget from the studio: 15 000$ tuition, 15 000$ living costs)

Who allow themselves the full experience and expression of what they are. What is more powerful... To not preach about it, to not tell people what to do or not to do, not even to try to prove anything, but to simply unfold within oneself, allowing others to be touched by that expression in their own time. I am convinced that I can inspire our youth to realize that it is possible to be the leaders of our own lives by daring to be free in my expression through my acting, singing and performing.What greater gift can I be given than to enter this tradition! I CANNOT IMAGINE ANYTHING GREATER, MORE PROFOUND, HEALING AND EFFECTIVE.Helping me to continue my studies, you are not only giving me a chance to fulfill my dream, you are planting seeds of arms that will grow so that I may reach every child on my journey, being a proof of the worth and abilities each and every one is born with. With all my heart I thank you for reading this,Siw Laurent"All she needs is one thousand people giving 30$ each, and we believe she will make it! (See photos for estimated budget from the studio: 15 000$ tuition, 15 000$ living costs)

story:
I have been building Chess Club Live since late 2007 and since then there hasn't been a day I haven't thought about how to improve the network of chess pages and social chess connections for the chess fans who care to join. 

Chess Club Live makes no money because I choose it that way, fans should never be made to pay for sharing their joy of chess, that is a matter of principle. Commercial chess enterprises and chess product sellers who make money from chess do however need to contribute to the upkeep of the platform which enables them reach their target "captive" audience - in other words You.

Content providers who are non-profit should not need to pay for sharing their high quality chess content to chess fans.

What is clear is for Chess Club Live to grow and get to the next level it needs to stop relying on my limitless passion for chess and unlimited  cash supply for the running costs which now run into the thousands of dollars each year.

So I put a proposal to any intrepid entrepreneur with money to invest and who ever had the desire to run a chess social network.

My proposal is simple. I propose you to support this social chess network brand to form a stronger united brand in which you fund Chess Club Live to keep it growing and delivering free chess content by free chess content providers.

Chess Club Live consists of the following core web and social platform assets and intellectual property.

1) Chess Club Live doman - chessclublive.com

2) Social Networking Platform - social.chessclublive.com 

3) Chess Club Live Facebook Page 205K fans - www.facebook.com/chessclublive

4) Chess Club Live Twitter page 30K followers twitter.com/chessclublive

5) Fast Chess Service - RSS Chess Feed on Zapier - Update every 5 minutes - FastChess on Zapier

6) Fast Chess Twitter - twitter.com/FastChess

non-core intellectual property which I created is 

7)ChessMaster Cube FB page - www.facebook.com/chessmastercube

8)ChessMaster Cube Web app.  http://social.chessclublive.com/chess_master_cube.html

9)Chess Patterns FB page - www.facebook.com/mychesspatterns

10) Chess Pattern Twitter page - https://twitter.com/ChessPatterns1

11) Chess Time Machine FB page - www.facebook.com/ChessTimeMachine

12) Chess Time Machine Twitter page - www.twitter.com/ChessTMachine

13) webchessapps.agilityhoster.com subdomain with MYSQL database and php scripts for creating content for 7) 8) 9) 10) 11) 12) and 14)

14) Opening of the Day, Strategic Tip of the Day, Tactic of the Day, Ending of the Day which are in an RSS feed built dynamically from the subdomain in 13)

15) Paper Li Pro - https://paper.li/ChessClubLive/1333266232

16) Animoto Video Library - A library of over 80 chess video player tributes, tournament promos and summaries

17)  Web Fen image display. Allows you to display a chess board on FB or Twitter or on a website using FEN. http://zxm.me

 example http://zxm.me/?fen=rnbqkbnr/pppppppp/8/8/4P3/8/PPPP1PPP/RNBQKBNR


The running costs for Chess Club Live are as follows:

Zapier pro - $30 a month

Social Go - $30 a month

Animoto - $30 a month

Domain Hosting - $300 a year

Feedly pro - $30 a month

Vimeo pro - $30 a month

This gives an annual running cost of approximately $2100

I value the above to be worth in excess of $50K. The valuation is based on the predicted growth of the CCL FB page, social networking platform and the potential for monetizing the chess feeds and the net worth of the brand Chess Club Live. Which has now become synonymous with edgy, engaging, chess content across the global chess community.

I estimate the earning potential of the Social CCL page and the to be from selling advertising space to chess product sellers. The 3 tabs on the CCL FB page can be rented out at $150 a month, and the advertising potential of the social platform is limit less as the user base grows. The adverts can be embedded on each page and specific product pages can be designed at an additional cost.

Estimated Revenue of Chess Club Live - Monthly Income

i) 3 x $150 = $450 from FB tab space rental (month)

ii) Assuming only 3 advertisers each with a page ($100 per month) = $300

iii) Sell rental space on the CCL FB cover page is optional but could net more income

Estimated Annual Income = $750 x 12 = $9000

Estimated Annual Net Profit = $6900

These figures are all estimates as I presently do not sell advertising space anywhere on Chess Club Live platforms.

I also have not included the potential of the growing the user base which is growing and offering chess product testing services for chess product sellers. Also there is potential for growth of both the CCL fan base and the Social CCL fan base. 

The CCL FB page is currently the most active page by post activity this buzz and engagement with active and committed chess fans, getting such a "captive" audience is an advertiser's wet dream.

The money you invest in our vision today will help us make that vision a reality, to provide a free global chess community into the future.

story:
Short Summary

These two little girls mean so much to my mom and I. They are part of our family and we have been supporting their schooling since 2009. With rising costs in Uganda it has become too much for us to keep up alone. Please help us ensure these two young ladies:

  • Continue to receive a quality education (the majority of children living in Uganda DO NOT have access to this)
  • Are not married to much older men when they are in their early teens
  • Have the opportunity to become leaders in a country that desperately needs educated young women who can become advocates for others like themselves
I made this video in 2009 when they were just about to start nursery school, mostly to get my mom on board as a co-sponsor. It worked on her, so I'm going to try again on you. This month they start Grade 5 … but we can only make this happen with your help.

What We Need & What You Get

For each girl to go to school for one semester it costs $550 so we are aiming for $2000 which will help us cover 2 semesters for both Martha & Mercy. This total covers:
  • Tuition
  • Boarding (we had them at a non-boarding school but the transport - petrol is so expensive in Uganda! - was more expensive than putting them in boarding)
  • Uniforms
  • Books, paper, etc.
We would love to include everyone who donates in our excitement over report cards and photo updates! By educating these two little girls we all have the ability to change other lives in their community and for the next generation of this family. Young women in Uganda need role models and advocates.

Risks & Challenges

Do know that this donation will not come with a tax receipt and it is based on trust. My mother has been sending this family and school money for many years and we receive updates from their parents over the internet. Photos, report cards, stories, etc. 

My mom and I trust the family and hope you will too.

When this is over we will look at plans for next year and see where to go from there. We would love to keep supporters as a part of this family!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to make a commitment today, please share this campaign with your network. You never know who is looking for a way to change the world, one little girl at a time. Thank you so much for reading this far! xoxoxo

story:
German translation see below / Deutsche Übersetzung siehe unten

Who we are

Kanyala Little Stars Academy was founded in the early 2000s by Benter Odhiambo, who saw the effect of HIV/AIDS epidemic was having on her community and on the children, and decided that something needed to be done to ensure the children were still able to be educated. As a retired teacher herself, Benter decided to start a school for the orphans and vulnerable children of her surroundings. On Rusinga Island where the School is located she is only known as the warm hearted Mama Benter. Unfortunately she died in 2013. But Samwel Asingo Odhiambo and his motivated team is continuing the great idea of Mama Benter.

About the Word Kanyala:
It means ‘WE CAN’ in Dholou, the native language of the people in this part of Kenya.


Where we are

Kanyala Little Stars Academy is located on beautiful Rusinga Island in western Kenya. Lake Victoria and many Mountains are shaping the countryside. The students are coming from the next town on the mainland, called Mbita and all around Rusinga Island. Some of them are walking up to one hour to school.

Our progress during the last 14 years

Since founding the number of students increased continuously because of many child-headed families in Kenya. Today the primary has also a nursery and preschool class. In all there are more than 300 children coming day by day to school. They really appreciate the opportunity of getting education! The school facilities were expanded and improved several times. Now we can dispose of some bricked classrooms with light for the evening. During the short history of our organization we could assemble a successful team of teachers and other staff which guarantees a high quality of teaching. The reputation of Little Stars Academy is very good.

Kanyala Little Stars is now a manifold organization. We promote and provide humanitarian support, technical assistance and emergency relief to disadvantaged people through the school, horticulture farm, a small bread bakery and a seedling nursery. The goal is to promote holistic community development through education and sustainable agriculture. Our organization is comprised of youth, women, widows, orphans and vulnerable children.


Challenges

The major reasons why Mama Benter founded Little Stars Organization were the variety of challenges around. Although fishing in Lake Victoria is giving many people an income, poverty is ever-present. A huge amount of people is still living on less than one dollar a day. You can imagine: without money, health is a problem too. The whole county is suffering on diseases like cholera, malaria and HIV. The best response on this is education. But it must be available at affordable costs. Little Stars Academy is a private school which is not supported by the government. The school is funded by school fees and sponsors. Poor families are supported by the community.

We try to give as many children as possible a chance of education. But in fact we cannot consider all the admission request because of limited space.

The old Kitchen

About half of the pupils do not go home during lunch break. They have a meal at school. It is a daily challenge to prepare 160 meals. The kitchen is still a part of the first build houses. It’s not bricked; it’s made out of iron sheets which can be seen so often in Kenya. We are using Africans most common cooking method – which is cooking on fire with collected firewood. The main problem with this is the smoke. The work for the kitchen staff is not easy because of irritated eyes and difficulty breathing. Often smoke is going into some classrooms and is disturbing the lessons.

Due to the simple construction of the building it is not possible to guarantee a hygienic environment which should be sure for preparing meals for our pupils. Proper cleaning of the sooty walls and the uneven floor is almost impossible. We want to change the bad conditions.


Our idea

For now it is our most important task to renew the room and create a kitchen which deserves the name kitchen. What we want to do:

·  Renew the kitchen by local contractors

·  Bricked building with lockable door and two windows

·  Metal sheet roof

·  Solid and adequate two burner stove for large pots (each 100 litres)

·  Chimney to bring the smoke outwards

·  Easy to clean and stable work surface / floor

·  Basin for washing the dishes


You can help us

We at Little Stars Academy try to help as many families as possible, giving their children education. But now we need help - the help of people around the world who appreciates our work. With this crowdfunding campaign it’s easy for you to support us. We hope to realize the essential renovation which costs $ 4.000 all in price during the next three month. We will inform you about the progress. All donators are welcome to visit beautiful Rusinga Island and see the work of Little Stars Academy at the face!

What does it cost in detail?

Description

pc

Amount

2 burner stove 100 l

1

Ksh  110.000,00

$  1.074,32

Bricks

Ksh  100.000,00

$  976,66



Ksh  402.200,00

$  3.928,12

What will happen if the money is not completely raised?

The stove with chimney (around $ 1.100) is our most important goal. If the money is not enough for a new bricked building we will improve the old one to make it more hygienic. The raised money will be spent to the kitchen in any case!

You can’t help us with a donation?

No problem, but you can support us anyway! Please help us to spread this campaign with talking about it with your friends! It would be great to share it in social media.


German translation / Deutsche Übersetzung

Wer wir sind

Die Kanyala Little Stars Academy wurde in den frühen 2000er Jahren von Frau Benter Odhiambo gegründet. Sie wollte den gravierenden Auswirkungen der herrschenden HIV/AIDS Epidemie in ihrer Gemeinde etwas entgegen setzten. Vor allem die vielen Waisenkinder litten sehr unter der Situation und konnten nicht zur Schule gehen. Frau Odhiambo gründete die Grundschule als pensionierte Lehrerin. Auf der Insel Rusinga, wo die Schule liegt war sie besser bekannt als die warmherzige Mama Benter. Leider starb sie im Jahr 2013. Aber ihre Söhne, vor allem Samwel Asingo Odhiambo und sein engagiertes Team setzen die großartige Idee von Mama Benter weiter fort.

Über das Wort Kanyala:
Es ist Dholou, die Muttersprache der Menschen in dieser Gegend Kenias und bedeutet „Wir können“.

Wo wir sind

Die Kanyala Little Stars Academy liegt auf der landschaftlich sehr schönen Insel Rusinga, im Westen von Kenia. Der Viktoriasee und viele Berge prägen die Landschaft. Die Schüler kommen aus dem direkten Umfeld der naheliegenden Stadt Mbita und von der ganzen Insel. Manche von ihnen gehen täglich eine Stunde zur Schule.

Unser Fortschritt in den letzten 14 Jahren

Seit der Gründung ist die Anzahl der Schüler kontinuierlich gestiegen. Viele Familien sind sehr kinderreich. Heute hat die Grundschule auch eine Kindergartengruppe und eine Vorschulklasse. Insgesamt kommen jeden Tag mehr als 300 Kinder zur Schule. Sie genießen die Möglichkeit Bildung zu erhalten. Das Schulgebäude wurde mehrmals erweitert und verbessert. Jetzt gibt es sogar einige gemauerte Klassenräume mit Licht für die Abendstunden. Innerhalb der überschaubaren Geschichte der Schule konnte ein erfolgreiches Team von Lehrern und anderen Bediensteten zusammengestellt werden, die eine hohe Qualität von Unterricht ermöglichen. Die Reputation der Little Stars Academy ist sehr gut.

Die Schule ist Teil einer vielfältigen Organisation. Die Little Stars Organisation unterstützt bedürftige Menschen, bietet technische Hilfe und Erleichterungen für notleidende oder benachteiligte Personen. Dies geschieht durch die Schule, eine Farm, eine kleine Bäckerei, und eine Pflanzenzucht. Das Ziel ist es umfangreiche Verbesserungen durch die Vermittlung von Bildung und der Landwirtschaft voranzutreiben. Die Organisation richtet sich an die Jugend, Frauen, Witwen, Waisen und benachteiligte Kinder.

Herausforderungen

Der herausragende Grund, warum Mama Benter die Little Stars Organisation gründete waren die vielfältigen Probleme in der Gegend. Obwohl die Fischerei im Viktoriasee vielen Menschen ein Einkommen gibt ist Armut allgegenwärtig. Ein großer Teil der Bevölkerung lebt von unter einem Dollar am Tag. Man kann sich vorstellen, ohne Geld ist die Gesundheit ebenso ein großes Problem. Die ganze Provinz leidet immer wieder unter Ausbrüchen von Krankheiten wie Cholera oder Malaria. Und HIV ist nach wie vor sehr weit verbreitet. Was man dem entgegensetzten kann? Bildung! Aber diese Bildung muss zu erschwinglichen Preisen verfügbar sein. Die Little Stars Academy ist eine private Schule die nicht von der Regierung unterstütz wird. Die Schule finanziert sich durch Schulgebühren und Spenden. Arme Familien werden unterstützt.

Wir versuchen so vielen Kindern wie möglich die Chance von Bildung zu ermöglichen. Aber leider können aufgrund der begrenzten Kapazität nicht alle Kinder aufgenommen werden.

Die alte Küche

Ungefähr die Hälfte der Kinder essen in der Mittagspause nicht zu Hause. Sie bekommen eine Mahlzeit in der Schule. Es ist eine tägliche Herausforderung die 160 Portionen zuzubereiten. Die Küche ist noch ein Teil der zuerst errichteten Gebäude. Sie ist nicht gemauert, sondern aus dem in Afrika allgegenwärtigem Wellblech gebaut. Wir nutzen die vorherrschende Kochmethode, das Kochen mit offenem Feuer und gesammeltem Holz. Das größte Problem damit ist der entstehende Rauch. Die Arbeit für das Küchenteam ist oft schwierig wegen brennender Augen und erschwerter Atmung. Oft zieht der Rauch auch in naheliegende Klassenzimmer und stört den Unterricht.

Aufgrund der einfachen Konstruktion des Gebäudes ist es nicht möglich eine hygienische Umgebung zu schaffen, die eigentlich selbstverständlich sein sollte um Mahlzeiten für die Kinder zuzubereiten. Eine gründliche Reinigung der rußigen Wände ist fast unmöglich. Wir wollen diesen Zustand ändern.

Unsere Idee

Gegenwärtig ist es unsere wichtigste Aufgabe die Küche zu erneuern, so dass sie den Namen Küche verdient. Was wir machen möchten:

·  Erneuern der Küche durch lokale Handwerker

·  Ein gemauertes Gebäude mit abschließbarer Tür und zwei Fenstern.

·  Ein Metalldach

·  Anschaffung eines soliden Herdes für zwei große Töpfe (je 100 Liter)

·  Ein Schornstein für den entstehenden Rauch

·  Eine leicht zu reinigende Arbeitsumgebung

·  Ein Becken um das Geschirr zu waschen

Sie können uns helfen

Wir von der Little Stars Academy versuchen täglich so vielen Familien wie möglich zu helfen, indem wir ihre Kinder unterrichten. Aber jetzt brauchen wir Hilfe. Die Hilfe von Menschen aus verschiedensten Ländern – die unsere Arbeit schätzen. Mit dieser Kampagne ist es einfach für Sie uns zu helfen. Wir hoffen die nötige Erneuerung der Küche – die 4.000 $ kosten wird – in den nächsten drei Monaten realisieren zu können. Wir werden über alle Fortschritte berichten. Wir würden uns freuen auch einmal Unterstützer vor Ort kennen zu lernen!

Die Kosten im Detail

Beschreibung

Stück

Betrag

Betrag in Dollar

Doppelherd 100 l

1

$  1.074,32

Ziegelsteine

Was passiert, wenn nicht der gesamte Betrag gespendet wird?

Der Herd mit Rauchabzug (ca. 1.100 $) ist unser größtes Anliegen. Wenn nicht genügend Geld für ein gemauertes Gebäude gespendet wird möchten wir die Küche so gut es geht verbessern um sie hygienischer zu machen. Das gespendete Geld wird in jedem Falle in die Küche investiert!

Sie können uns nicht helfen?

Das ist kein Problem, aber Sie können uns dennoch unterstützten. Bitte helfen Sie uns diese Kampagne zu verbreiten und sprechen Sie mit Freunden darüber. Es wäre großartig diese Seite in sozialen Medien zu teilen.

by day to school. They really appreciate the opportunity of getting education!
The school facilities were expanded and improved several times. Now we can
dispose of some bricked classrooms with light for the evening. During the short
history of our organization we could assemble a successful team of teachers and
other staff which guarantees a high quality of teaching. The reputation of
Little Stars Academy is very good. 
Kanyala Little Stars is now a manifold organization. We
promote and provide humanitarian support, technical assistance and emergency
relief to disadvantaged people through the school, horticulture farm, a small
bread bakery and a seedling nursery. The goal is to promote holistic community
development through education and sustainable agriculture. Our organization is
comprised of youth, women, widows, orphans and vulnerable children.Challenges
The major reasons why Mama Benter founded Little Stars
Organization were the variety of challenges around. Although fishing in Lake
Victoria is giving many people an income, poverty is ever-present. A huge
amount of people is still living on less than one dollar a day. You can
imagine: without money, health is a problem too. The whole county is suffering
on diseases like cholera, malaria and HIV. The best response on this is
education. But it must be available at affordable costs. Little Stars Academy
is a private school which is not supported by the government. The school is
funded by school fees and sponsors. Poor families are supported by the
community.
We try to give as many children as possible a chance of
education. But in fact we cannot consider all the admission request because of limited
space. 

The old Kitchen 
About half of the pupils do not go home during lunch break.
They have a meal at school. It is a daily challenge to prepare 160 meals. The
kitchen is still a part of the first build houses. It’s not bricked; it’s made
out of iron sheets which can be seen so often in Kenya. We are using Africans
most common cooking method – which is cooking on fire with collected firewood.
The main problem with this is the smoke. The work for the kitchen staff is not
easy because of irritated eyes and difficulty breathing. Often smoke is going
into some classrooms and is disturbing the lessons.
Due to the simple construction of the building it is not
possible to guarantee a hygienic environment which should be sure for preparing
meals for our pupils. Proper cleaning of the sooty walls and the uneven floor
is almost impossible. We want to change the bad conditions.Our idea
For now it is our most important task to renew the room and
create a kitchen which deserves the name kitchen. What we want to do: 
· 
Renew the kitchen by local contractors
· 
Bricked building with lockable door and two
windows
· 
Metal sheet roof
· 
Solid and adequate two burner stove for large
pots (each 100 litres)
· 
Chimney to bring the smoke outwards
· 
Easy to clean and stable work surface / floor
· 
Basin for washing the dishes
You can help us
We at Little Stars Academy try to help as many families as
possible, giving their children education. But now we need help - the help of
people around the world who appreciates our work. With this crowdfunding
campaign it’s easy for you to support us. We hope to realize the essential
renovation which costs $ 4.000 all in price during the next three month. We
will inform you about the progress. All donators are welcome to visit beautiful
Rusinga Island and see the work of Little Stars Academy at the face!

What will happen if
the money is not completely raised?
The stove with chimney (around $ 1.100) is our most
important goal. If the money is not enough for a new bricked building we will
improve the old one to make it more hygienic. The raised money will be spent to
the kitchen in any case!
You can’t help us
with a donation?
No problem, but you can support us anyway! Please help us to
spread this campaign with talking about it with your friends! It would be great
to share it in social media.German translation / Deutsche Übersetzung
Wer wir sind
Die Kanyala
Little Stars Academy wurde in den frühen 2000er Jahren von Frau Benter Odhiambo
gegründet. Sie wollte den gravierenden Auswirkungen der herrschenden HIV/AIDS
Epidemie in ihrer Gemeinde etwas entgegen setzten. Vor allem die vielen
Waisenkinder litten sehr unter der Situation und konnten nicht zur Schule gehen. Frau Odhiambo
gründete die Grundschule als pensionierte Lehrerin. Auf der Insel Rusinga, wo
die Schule liegt war sie besser bekannt als die warmherzige Mama Benter. Leider
starb sie im Jahr 2013. Aber ihre Söhne, vor allem Samwel Asingo Odhiambo und
sein engagiertes Team setzen die großartige Idee von Mama Benter weiter fort. 
Über das Wort Kanyala:
Es ist Dholou, die Muttersprache der Menschen in dieser Gegend Kenias und
bedeutet „Wir können“.
Wo wir sind
Die Kanyala
Little Stars Academy liegt auf der landschaftlich sehr schönen Insel Rusinga,
im Westen von Kenia. Der Viktoriasee und viele Berge prägen die Landschaft. Die
Schüler kommen aus dem direkten Umfeld der naheliegenden Stadt Mbita und von
der ganzen Insel. Manche von ihnen gehen täglich eine Stunde zur Schule.
Unser Fortschritt in den letzten
14 Jahren
Seit der Gründung
ist die Anzahl der Schüler kontinuierlich gestiegen. Viele Familien sind sehr kinderreich. Heute hat die Grundschule auch eine Kindergartengruppe und eine
Vorschulklasse. Insgesamt kommen jeden Tag mehr als 300 Kinder zur Schule.
Sie genießen die Möglichkeit Bildung zu erhalten. Das Schulgebäude wurde
mehrmals erweitert und verbessert. Jetzt gibt es sogar einige gemauerte
Klassenräume mit Licht für die Abendstunden. Innerhalb der überschaubaren
Geschichte der Schule konnte ein erfolgreiches Team von Lehrern und anderen
Bediensteten zusammengestellt werden, die eine hohe Qualität von Unterricht
ermöglichen. Die Reputation der Little Stars Academy ist sehr gut.
Die Schule ist
Teil einer vielfältigen Organisation. Die Little Stars Organisation unterstützt
bedürftige Menschen, bietet technische Hilfe und Erleichterungen für
notleidende oder benachteiligte Personen. Dies geschieht durch die Schule, eine
Farm, eine kleine Bäckerei, und eine Pflanzenzucht. Das Ziel ist es umfangreiche
Verbesserungen durch die Vermittlung von Bildung und der Landwirtschaft
voranzutreiben. Die Organisation richtet sich an die Jugend, Frauen, Witwen,
Waisen und benachteiligte Kinder. 
Herausforderungen
Der herausragende
Grund, warum Mama Benter die Little Stars Organisation gründete waren die
vielfältigen Probleme in der Gegend. Obwohl die Fischerei im Viktoriasee vielen
Menschen ein Einkommen gibt ist Armut allgegenwärtig. Ein großer Teil der
Bevölkerung lebt von unter einem Dollar am Tag. Man kann sich vorstellen, ohne
Geld ist die Gesundheit ebenso ein großes Problem. Die ganze Provinz leidet
immer wieder unter Ausbrüchen von Krankheiten wie Cholera oder Malaria. Und HIV
ist nach wie vor sehr weit verbreitet. Was man dem entgegensetzten kann?
Bildung! Aber diese Bildung muss zu erschwinglichen Preisen verfügbar sein. Die
Little Stars Academy ist eine private Schule die nicht von der Regierung
unterstütz wird. Die Schule finanziert sich durch Schulgebühren und Spenden.
Arme Familien werden unterstützt.
Wir versuchen so
vielen Kindern wie möglich die Chance von Bildung zu ermöglichen. Aber leider
können aufgrund der begrenzten Kapazität nicht alle Kinder aufgenommen werden.

Die
alte Küche
Ungefähr die Hälfte
der Kinder essen in der Mittagspause nicht zu Hause. Sie bekommen eine Mahlzeit
in der Schule. Es ist eine tägliche Herausforderung die 160 Portionen
zuzubereiten. Die Küche ist noch ein Teil der zuerst errichteten Gebäude. Sie ist
nicht gemauert, sondern aus dem in Afrika allgegenwärtigem Wellblech gebaut.
Wir nutzen die vorherrschende Kochmethode, das Kochen mit offenem Feuer und
gesammeltem Holz. Das größte Problem damit ist der entstehende Rauch. Die
Arbeit für das Küchenteam ist oft schwierig wegen brennender Augen und
erschwerter Atmung. Oft zieht der Rauch auch in naheliegende Klassenzimmer und
stört den Unterricht.
Aufgrund der
einfachen Konstruktion des Gebäudes ist es nicht möglich eine hygienische
Umgebung zu schaffen, die eigentlich selbstverständlich sein sollte um
Mahlzeiten für die Kinder zuzubereiten. Eine gründliche Reinigung der rußigen
Wände ist fast unmöglich. Wir wollen diesen Zustand ändern.

Unsere Idee
Gegenwärtig ist
es unsere wichtigste Aufgabe die Küche zu erneuern, so dass sie den Namen Küche
verdient. Was wir machen möchten:
·  Erneuern der Küche durch lokale Handwerker
·  Ein gemauertes Gebäude mit abschließbarer
Tür und zwei Fenstern.
·  Ein Metalldach
·  Anschaffung eines soliden Herdes für zwei
große Töpfe (je 100 Liter)
·  Ein Schornstein für den entstehenden Rauch
·  Eine leicht zu reinigende Arbeitsumgebung
·  Ein Becken um das Geschirr zu waschen
Sie können uns helfen
Wir von der
Little Stars Academy versuchen täglich so vielen Familien wie möglich zu
helfen, indem wir ihre Kinder unterrichten. Aber jetzt brauchen wir Hilfe. Die
Hilfe von Menschen aus verschiedensten Ländern – die unsere Arbeit schätzen.
Mit dieser Kampagne ist es einfach für Sie uns zu helfen. Wir hoffen die
nötige Erneuerung der Küche – die 4.000 $ kosten wird – in den nächsten drei
Monaten realisieren zu können. Wir werden über alle Fortschritte berichten. Wir
würden uns freuen auch einmal Unterstützer vor Ort kennen zu lernen!

Was passiert, wenn nicht der gesamte Betrag
gespendet wird?
Der Herd mit
Rauchabzug (ca. 1.100 $) ist unser größtes Anliegen. Wenn nicht genügend Geld
für ein gemauertes Gebäude gespendet wird möchten wir die Küche so gut es geht
verbessern um sie hygienischer zu machen. Das gespendete Geld wird in jedem
Falle in die Küche investiert!
Sie können uns nicht helfen?
Das ist kein
Problem, aber Sie können uns dennoch unterstützten. Bitte helfen Sie uns diese
Kampagne zu verbreiten und sprechen Sie mit Freunden darüber. Es wäre großartig
diese Seite in sozialen Medien zu teilen.

story:
How does Climate impact Arctic Life?

The Narwhal, with its mysterious spiral tooth, has been a muse for myth and science. 

 

Their numbers are limited: about 80,000 worldwide (WWF), one-fifth the human population of the arctic region. Between 1987 and 2004, the narwhal population has dropped about 6 percent per year. If we extrapolate that decline to now, the decline has reached over 80% since the mid-1980’s. (Heide-Jørgensen's study). As our climate drives down the road of exponential change, the affect on all life will exceed our imaginations. However, studies show that Narwhals are among the most vulnerable. Will these beasts become just a legend? 

 

The arctic of the past sat in balance. Inuit hunters coexisted with the living and non-living aspects of the environment. The world existed in dynamic homeostasis.  

 

Zoom out on the axis of time. Since the start of life on Earth, there have been 8 major drops in life, beginning with the oxygen die off, over 2 billion years ago, and continuing on until the dinosaur, or Cretaceous extinction, 65 million years ago. 

 

The history of extinctions shows us that there is a direct correlation between temperature and diversity of life. Both temperature and diversity change constantly, but the current rate of change is our cause for concern. 

 

Continuous positive feedback – whereby the affect of a process amplifies that process – gives rise to cascading change. Higher temperatures, for example, can change the heat reflection quality, or albedo, of the Earth. In the Arctic, rising atmospheric temperature melts ice, leaving behind bare rock and water that absorb greater quantities of heat from the sun.

 

Changing ice conditions have an impact on all arctic inhabitants. Warmer water benefits plankton, and less sea ice results in a soaring killer whale population, which needs open ocean. The killer whales are quickly overtaking polar bears as the north’s top predator. 

 

Narwhals live much of their lives underneath a thick layer of ice. However, as mammals, they must surface to breath. Recently, there have been reports of whales becoming trapped under the ice when fractures freeze over due to sudden shifts in the weather. Desperate, hundreds of whales will squeeze into closing chasms. Many suffocate or become easy prey for polar bears circled around the gap. 

 

The Inuit peoples call this phenomenon “sassat.” They have observed it for hundreds of years, but recent reports have shocking implications. The entrapments occurred at an unusual time of year, in an unusual location: the whale’s summer feeding grounds, as opposed to their winter territory. “The Narwhales were in the wrong place at the wrong time,” according to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration [US]. Is this an affect of the changing sea ice conditions? 

Schools On Board

In October, my head full of questions, I embark on a trip to our planet’s far north. Along with eight other high school students and two teachers from Canada, I will be immersed in experiential learning. Through Schools on Board, a program run by the University of Manitoba and ArcticNet, we will travel to Resolute, Nunavut, where we will board the Coast Guard vessel The CCGS Amundsen. Along with leading Arctic scientists, we will head east, through Lancaster Sound, conducting oceanographic sampling operations, then north, between Ellesmere Island and Greenland. The trip will conclude with a community visit in Pond Inlet, Nunavut. 

 

While experiencing the Arctic in all of its elements, we will learn through lectures, workshops and laboratory experiments. There will be an emphasis on social and environmental issues so that the understanding we gain will be both a microscopic and a broad view of the ecosystem. 

 

Schools on Board is an opportunity for learning as a whole. If an ecosystem is a collection of relationships, being in the midst of those interactions and experiencing them with all of our senses is crucial. I hope to come away with a deep connection to Arctic life, and an understanding of human impact upon it.

 

When each participant flies back to his or her home community, they will continue to spread their experience of the North. I plan on bringing back what I have learnt to both of my communities. In Campbell River, I will share photos, videos, and stories through the Carihi Earth Club and the science department. I am in the process of arranging visits to museums, elementary schools, and community centers in Campbell River and on Cortes Island. I will also keep a blog while I am away. 

 

How You Can Help

As part of my efforts to fund the trip, I am launching an Indiegogo campaign. The program cost is $ 3,750 CAD plus travel to Winnipeg, MB. Each contribution makes a difference, but if I am not able to reach my goal, I will fund the rest through my own savings. Armed with watercolors and pens, I will send contributors postcards with a small piece of something I have learnt or observed during the trip. I hope that this is another way of spreading inspiration as far as the post can reach. 

 

Although the “unicorns of the sea” are diminishing, our understanding of them is growing. Recent research shows that the male Narwhal’s tusk holds up to 10 million nerve endings. As a receptor to the outside world, these sensitive teeth detect shifts in temperature, salinity, and pressure. Could this ocean antenna allow the narwhals to adapt to their changing environment?

 

The Narwhal’s tusk demonstrates the knowledge that is imbedded in our north. It is the responsibility of my generation to seek understanding of our planet and use it for the wellbeing of all life on Earth. Schools on Board provides the medium to learn.
