story:
I will be going to Singapore with at least 10 of my students in the Certified E-Commerce Specialist, Entrepreneur, and Professional Program module 8 this September 9 to 13, 2015. We will be using the trip as an opportunity to:

  1. Meet strategic e-commerce players in the region.
  2. Learn about e-commerce start-up entrepreneur funding opportunities.
  3. Expanding or opening a business presence in Singapore.

By this time, they have done a lot of work and investment in building their respective e-commerce projects that they will be showcasing in the E-Commerce Entrepreneurs Summit 2015.

I believe that this trip to Singapore will further expand their horizon and perspective. Realizing that their opportunities are not only limited to the Philippines but can even go outside of it.

What is your training program about?

The Certified E-Commerce Specialist, Entrepreneur, and Professional Program aims to assist students in having a well-rounded knowledge in putting up an e-commerce business.

This is our 1st batch of students. This is part of my vision in the DigitalFilipino Start-Up 100 Project in helping e-commerce entrepreneurs in their endeavors.

In conjunction with my free DigitalFilipino E-Commerce Boot Camp learning resources, I aim to reach out to 1 million Filipinos in building their e-commerce knowledge and become active players in this space.

What will you do with the money raised?

Our students will pay for their respective airfare.

We promise to only use the funds raised for the expenses while in Singapore such as accommodation, transportation (moving from one meeting to another), meals, working space, and tokens to be given to the people we will meet.

Why aren't you making your students pay for the living expenses while in Singapore?

Our students are young professionals with limited resources. This is currently spent also on building their respective e-commerce projects.

The fundraising aims to partly or fully cover our Singapore expenses so that our students can focus their own resource on finishing their projects.

What perks or rewards are you giving?

US$20 social media shoutout perk
I will do a social media shout-out thanking contributors by citing their website url or social media page on my Facebook page, LinkedIn, Google+, and Twitter.

US$25 E-Commerce Entrepreneur Shirt
The "E-Commerce Entrepreneur" shirt reflects the heart of our campaign in this learning program - in developing e-commerce entrepreneurs. This is an exclusive shirt only given in 2013 to E-Commerce Boot Camp and E-Commerce Entrepreneurs Summit participants.

US$100 E-Commerce Protege Membership
I am also giving Protege membership access to the DigitalFilipino E-Commerce Boot Camp that gives donor full access to our paid content for one year.

US$100 E-Commerce Entrepreneurs Summit
We are scheduled to have the E-Commerce Entrepreneurs Summit on August 29, 2015. Donors who will pick this perk or reward will be entitled to a delegate slot. Our students will also showcase their e-commerce projects in this event.

US$200 Pro EntrepLounge
Get almost US$50 off with the Pro EntrepLounge package. This includes domain name registration, web hosting service with cPanel account (1GB), brand and strategic management plan, MBA for E-Commerce Resources, and Basic Business Management Consultancy.

US$250 RM Nisperos Talk
RM Nisperos of EntrepLounge.com can give a talk at your organization on e-commerce, lean start-up, strategic management.

US$350 Basic SEO Website Audit
Originally valued at US$500, REDLETTERSPH.COM is giving a Basic SEO Website Audit at a discounted rate to help students in their fundraising efforts.

US$500 E-Commerce Talk
From time to time, I get invited to give talks or consultation session on e-commerce and digital marketing. For invitations outside of Metro Manila, airfare and accommodations are not included.

US$700 Join Us
Join us in this 4 day industry exposure activity. Airfare not included.
 
Your support to our students will be greatly appreciated.

story:
''Education is the most powerful weapon you can use to change the world." Nelson Mandela

Dear all,

We are four students currently enrolled in the bachelor Business Administration at the Nyenrode New Business University. For our course Project and Fundraising we are busy with the project 'Freedom Through Education' that is set up by the Round Table of India. For this project we want to raise as much money as possible, because we believe that education is the key to be able to develop yourself.  

The project

'Freedom Through Education' is an initiative of the Round Table of India. The project was set up in 1998 and builds schools in India for the children that need it most. Our school has been participating in this project for 9 years. This year there is a total of 4 groups of students that are going to India. Every group will be visiting another region. Every group will raise as much money as possible and at the end the total amount will be doubled by the Round Table in India!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise a minimum of 6000 dollars, but of course there is no limit to this.  By donating money you are making a huge change in India. You are giving underprivileged children the opportunity to follow education and develop themselves. Probably you are still at school, or you are a parent who is so proud of his or her child that is developing itself so fast. Imagine that this would not be possible and you or your children are never going to get the chance to develop and excel. Unfortunately this is the case for many, but you can make a difference.

The Impact

The objective of this project is to build schools and classrooms for the children that need it most. The money we raise goes directly to the Round Table India and will be used to realize this project. It will enable a lot of children to finally get the chance to follow education. It may sound simple, but it definitely is not. Some examples of the infrastructure that has to be realized:
- Build quality buildings
- Build toilets
- Classroom furniture
- Deep Tube-wells for Sanitation
- Computers

There are obviously many more things that need to be built, but this is just to give you an idea where your money will go. 


We tried to keep our story as short as possible, while we do not want to bother you with long and boring texts. For more information please visit: http://roundtableindia.org/projects/freedom-through-education

As we say in Dutch: "alle kleine beetjes helpen". 


Thank you for your time and contribution!

The team,

Max Sigtermans
Alvaro Kleinveld
Ditmer de Vries
Martijn Bartels
Victor Botterman
If you have any questions or further interest, please feel free to contact us at: m.sigtermans@my.nyenrode.nl.

story:
About Open Road

Open Road Learning Community for Teens is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit in Portland, OR that provides personalized education to teens (ages 11-18) who have been unhappy in traditional school.  Open Road teens are free to pursue their interests (and discover new ones) in any way they choose, as deeply as they choose, with nothing that limits what they can explore.  The teens work with trusted mentors at Open Road and in the wider community who serve as guides, teachers, tutors, and connectors to people and businesses in the community doing work our teens are interested in.  Our goal is simple: we want to fully support every teen in loving their lives, understanding and embracing their inner strengths even as they build new ones and overcome challenges, and exploring the world in ways that excite them and illuminate the paths into adulthood that feel right to them.  Having recently completed Year 2 of our program, we take great pride in our teens' growth and development.  Our members have explored sculpture; computer programming; primitive living skills; music instrument lessons, composition, and improvisation; current events, history, and social justice through a critical theory lens; traditional core school subjects as they prepare for the GED; and more. We look forward enthusiastically to building the Open Road community, serving more teens, and providing more opportunities for learning, growth, challenge, fun, and adventure!

Our Funding Needs Today

Open Road At A Crossroads

Though we're proud of how much the 20+ kids we've served have grown in the last two years, we have not been able to raise enough revenue to meet expenses.  As such, we've had to make the difficult decision to suspend primary operations for the next 1-3 years while we build towards a sustainable fiscal model and more robust program.  During this time, we will continue to work with existing members; we'll also focus on gaining a better understanding of the needs of Portland’s teens and their families, building our presence in Portland, providing community-wide programming (not only restricted to members), hosting community forums around teen and education issues, and building our network of community partners ready to work with our teens now and once we relaunch.  We believe that this focus will allow us to better understand and serve the needs of the Portland community, while also generating more partnerships and momentum around our relaunch that will help make Open Road an integral part of the education landscape here and provide more exciting opportunities for our members.  We’ve also added a new co-director, Joel Morrow (an Open Road volunteer for two years), who will join Alan to give Open Road two volunteer directors.  In short, we'll continue to operate as a much smaller business, consolidating and retooling to emerge stronger and sustainable.


What We Need

We’re revising our business plan to build towards sustainability, while continuing our direct work with kids.  Your gift will contribute to general funds that will allow us to meet our basic expenses (stipends for certain program volunteers, fees for professional services, insurance, program delivery, occasional space rental, etc.) while we move forward without much of the tuition revenue we’ve had in the past.


Our annual crowdfunding campaign has surpassed $10,000 in each of our first two years, and we're targeting that again in 2015.  As we remain very much in our start-up phase, every dollar counts!  In the past, we have forgone perks and prizes in order to put all of the donations we receive to work for our teens, and we'll do that again this year.  So what do you get?  Well, you get the satisfaction of knowing that you're helping change the lives of kids who need a different approach to their education than traditional school can give them.  And really, what better prize is there than the gift of giving back?

The Impact of Your Support

The video above shows some of the impact as described by some current members, and the video from last year's campaign shows more, with some commentary from parents as well.  Many of our teens were having a terrible time in traditional school and losing their connection to the things they loved.  At Open Road, these same kids have thrived.


Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you can make a donation, you can help this campaign succeed in other ways:

  • First and foremost, please share this campaign among your crowd!  Let folks know what we do and why you support it, and encourage them to come to this page and check it out for themselves.  If you can set a modest goal of getting 1-3 additional people to donate, you can help us raise significantly more money.  Share via email, social media, word of mouth - whatever is easiest.  But however you share, a personal endorsement from you will capture people's attention far more than a simple shared link.

  • We try to get a lot of visibility through our Facebook page.  But the way Facebook works, if you like our page but don't regularly like and share our posts, you'll stop seeing us altogether. And if we post a lot but don't get many likes or shares, our posts lose a lot of their impact. So perhaps the easiest way you can help, if you're on Facebook, is to like our page AND like and share many of our posts.  If you've already liked our page but haven't been seeing content, go to the page and like a bunch of recent posts, and you should start seeing things from us again.

  • If you know any families in the Portland area who might be interested in Open Road, let them know about us!

  • We're always thrilled to receive in-kind donations.  If you can more easily contribute things than money, please take a look at our website for a partial list of things that we could use.
story_txt:
About Open RoadOpen Road Learning Community for Teens is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit in Portland, OR that provides personalized education to teens (ages 11-18) who have been unhappy in traditional school.  Open Road teens are free to pursue their interests (and discover new ones) in any way they choose, as deeply as they choose, with nothing that limits what they can explore.  The teens work with trusted mentors at Open Road and in the wider community who serve as guides, teachers, tutors, and connectors to people and businesses in the community doing work our teens are interested in.  Our goal is simple: we want to fully support every teen in loving their lives, understanding and embracing their inner strengths even as they build new ones and overcome challenges, and exploring the world in ways that excite them and illuminate the paths into adulthood that feel right to them.  Having recently completed Year 2 of our program, we take great pride in our teens' growth and development.  Our members have explored sculpture; computer programming; primitive living skills; music instrument lessons, composition, and improvisation; current events, history, and social justice through a critical theory lens; traditional core school subjects as they prepare for the GED; and more. We look forward enthusiastically to building the Open Road community, serving more teens, and providing more opportunities for learning, growth, challenge, fun, and adventure!Our Funding Needs story:
About Pow Wow Pitch (and me)

  • My name is Sunshine Tenasco, I am a mommy to 4 funny kids, a wife-to-be, an entrepreneur, and I believe in empowering Aboriginal people.
  • Pow Wow Pitch was started 2 months ago because our team wanted to help Aboriginal entrepreneurs succeed.  Last Tuesday June 2, 2015 our funder abruptly pulled the plug on Pow Wow Pitch.  With that, went our prize money, our contracts, all our contacts, and our help.
BUT....... the dream lived on! 
In ONE week, Pow Wow Pitch has re-established:
  1. 1) Same amazing celebrity judges
    2) Same location in partnership with Summer Solstice
    3) Same high profile business mentors
    4) Brand new website
    5) Brand new social media
    6) Amazing team of volunteers!

So what is Pow Wow Pitch?

  • 30 entrepreneurs get 1 minute to “pitch” their business idea in front of a panel of celebrity judges.
  • The judges will chose 10 finalists to continue to the final round
  • The 10 finalists will work with a business mentor for 3 hours to perfect their pitch
  • The 10 finalists will get 3 minutes to pitch for a 2nd time to the panel of celebrity judges
  • 3 winners will be chosen

What We Need 

  • Our goal is to raise $8,500 for 3 prizes for 3 deserving Aboriginal entrepreneurs
1st- $5,000, 2nd - $2,500 and 3rd- $1,000
  • We will give out every single dollar we raise to the people who are brave enough to stand on that stage to share their entrepreneurial dreams with us.
  • If we don't raise enough, we will amend the prize money and distribute what we raise.
  • If we raise too much, we will amend the prize money and distribute what we raise.  
  • Either way, Aboriginal entrepreneurs will receive 100% of the funds we raise!

The Impact

  • By contributing you are supporting an important social issue.
  • By helping you will have the opportunity to hear about 30 Aboriginal businesses 
  • By contributing you are helping to uncover 3 Aboriginal business and give these three businesses a hand up.
  • By helping you are empowering Aboriginal people to use their voice, and encouraging them to be self sufficient.
  • By helping you are showing Aboriginal entrepreneurs that people do care, and that Aboriginal can be a part of the vibrant entrepreneurial community.
  • By helping Pow Wow Pitch you are giving directly back to the Aboriginal community.
  • By helping you are helping to change stereotypes.

Risks & Challenges

We realize the time constraints.  We realize that this is a big ask.  But in less than a week, we have resuscitated "Pow Wow Pitch".  We believe that the only risk is our failure..... but like true entrepreneurs, we are not afraid of failure.  The only failure is not trying.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get family and friends to help you fundraise
  • Share the campaign using the Indiegogo share tools
  • Use the hashtag #PowWowPitch on Twitter and Instagram
  • Like and share our Facebook page
Check out www.powwowpitch.com for more details.

story:
Who am I to do this?

Being half Syrian I have first-hand experience of family and friends devastated by the situation, being displaced, separated and if remaining in Syria, struggling on a daily basis to maintain their basic needs and safety.  

Syria is also deeply ingrained in my professional life, with my undertaking of a PhD on Syrian civil society and the non-violent movements of the uprising. In spite of this,  I felt I was doing little to practically support the people who have been struggling through the situation for over 4 and a half years. 

So fed up one day with my inaction, I came across the work of the NGO Relief & Reconciliation for Syria and their call for project volunteers for their Ramadan Summer Programme. After applying to run the Syria's Young Creative Writers I was gifted with the opportunity to run the project for two weeks in September as part of their larger Youth Press Club. 

What is the Project about? 

The project involves working with groups of students from Syria, between the ages of 14 and 19 years old, who are currently supported by Relief and Reconciliation at their Peace Centre in Akkar, Northern Lebanon.

The objective of the project is to encourage the creative thoughts and expressions of those who have experienced conflict, loss and tragedy. By taking part in this they would instead be able to use their imagination in a positive, constructive and creative way to write about anything they choose.

Upon completion of the students writing their stories, poems, plays, scripts or other form of creative writing I will be publishing them in a book collection. Not only is this important for the students as a recognition of their work but also for their voices and stories to be heard internationally so that they can be seen as individuals and not just a statistic which is all too often the case in the media. 

The Impact of the Project

Importantly this project aims to improve their English language skills and their ability to express their thoughts. While developing writing skills is always an element of learning English, creative writing, which promotes independent and creative thought, is usually only a small element of courses aimed at developing language skills. 

In this way, in order to really promote a continuous use of the language outside of the classroom this project aims to encourage a student to really interact with the language by thinking and using the language in a personal and imaginative way. As such most of the activities we intend to undertake aim not only to develop the student’s language skills but also give them a sense of ownership of the language and of their own thoughts and expressions. This as a consequence will aid in building a student’s confidence in their abilities to use the language in different situations, especially outside the classroom. 

This project also aims to create an alternative space, physically, socially and psychologically. This is vital in encouraging creative and critical thinking, which is one of the foundations necessary for rebuilding a future Syria to which one day such people will hopefully be able to return.


What the Project and R&R Need from YOU

Item Description                                     Cost Incurred By                 Estimated Cost

Travel & Transportation (X1)                         Self                                           £650

Food & Accommodation (1X15days)           R&R                                         £250

Transportation for Students                          R&R                                         £200

Equipment (Stationary, Computers...)      R&R                                          £150

Total Cost Incurred by Self                                                                               £650

Total Cost Incurred by R&R                                                                              £600

Total Cost of Project                                                                            £1250

What will your donations contribute towards? 

Any donation you make will contribute enormously to this project which ultimately aims to confront the limited availability of education and creative endeavors to an increasingly growing population of Syrian refugees.

In this way, your contributions will help this project in the following ways:

o  It will make it possible!

o  It will cover R&R’s costs of providing food and accommodation for myself and other volunteers

o  It will provide R&R with funding to cover costs in various other areas

o  Most importantly – it will provide a number of Syrian refugees with the opportunity to use their talents, on developing new skills and on finding hope towards their potential futures

Your donations may also provide you with the opportunity to select one of the perks of contributing to this project. Have a look down the right hand side of the page to see what is on offer!

If the target amount is not reached, anything contributed will still go towards covering initial costs incurred by myself and Relief & Reconciliation Syria.  

Anything above the target amount will be provided as a donation to Relief & Reconciliation Syria to support their continued work.

Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate that some of you simply can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

o  Please spread the word to friends, colleagues and family, you can use the Indiegogo share tools to do this! 

o  If there is any other support you think you can provide to this project please just get in touch with me. For example, any area of support with editing, proof reading, publisher contacts, etc. would not go a miss!

o  If you don’t know very much about the situation in Syria, please explore some of the links I have included and pass the information on!

story:
Saving The Lives of Diabetics Since 2009

Mary McNeight is a certified, multi-national, award-winning, teacher, author, professional speaker, mentor and service dog expert witness who specializes in training service dogs for medical alert.  She has helped to train over 115 medical alert dogs across the world.  On a daily basis these dogs help to keep alive children, grandchildren, fathers, mothers, sisters, daughters, brothers, grandfathers, grandmothers, cousins, aunts and uncles.  She specializes in teaching dogs to alert to diabetes, seizures, narcolepsy and migraines. 

Mary McNeight has been featured in media outlets across the world as an expert on medical alert dog training.

Mary has not only helped people train their own medical alert dogs, she has also helped teach countless dog trainers across the world her techniques.  In addition to producing the first FREE ebook on how to chose a service dog candidate, she has produced over 40 videos on her Youtube channel that give people free advice about how to train their own dogs to alert to their medical conditions.  Mary McNeight has been recognized by the Association of Professional Dog Trainers as an expert in service dog training and was a featured speaker at their 6000+ member conference in 2013.  Mary McNeight started her company, Service Dog Academy in 2008 when she could find no one in her area to help her train her own medical alert dog.

Mary McNeight with Victoria Stilwell and Ian Dunbar at the 2012 Association of Professional Dog Trainers Conference where Mary won the Dr. Robert Curran NewTrix Video Award.


A Place To Teach Puppies How To Save Their Owners Lives

Mary McNeight used to teach classes out of her own training studio, but with commercial rental costs skyrocketing in Seattle and her focus on small, quality one-on-one training experiences, the over $25,000 a year rent for her tiny studio became too much to bear.  Mary is now moving to a small town in Illinois to be closer to family and to open up an expanded facility that will allow her to take her training to the next level.  Mary has located a commercial property that will allow her to, in addition to her current services, provide trained diabetic alert dogs to people who need them, create additional online video programs for people who want to train their own medical alert dogs, host dog training seminars for positive reinforcement trainers and provide the worlds-first live-work, hands-on, intensive dog trainer training program for people who want to learn how to train these life saving diabetic alert dogs.

Mary is looking to raise $325,000 to:

  • Purchase the commercial property
  • Install fencing to create an outside play area
  • Install state of the art flooring system in the training area
  • Purchase equipment (including but not limited to): crates, agility tunnels & equipment, tables, chairs, shelving, lighting and sound equipment
  • Convert a portion of the space into 2 private bedrooms for visiting trainers engaged in the live-work intensive diabetic alert dog trainer program

If the fundraising goal is not met Mary will continue to provide the medical alert dog training services she currently offers and will utilize the funds to expand her training services equal to the scale of donations.  Any and all money donated will go towards helping people train their own dogs to save their lives.

Mary McNeight teaching puppy classes in Seattle, WA.


What Kind Of Impact Can We Make Together?

With over 25% of the population expected to have diabetes or pre-diabetes by 2020, the need for these lifesaving dogs is astronomical.  Unfortunately there are only a handful of professional dogs trainers across the country who are producing quality diabetic alert dogs.  With Mary's intensive trainer training program and online trainer training videos she can reach a wider audience.  She can only personally work with so many people per year, but if she shares her skills with other trainers, her ability to reach those in need effectively spiderwebs across the world!  You can help make this possible!  With just 10 trainers per year enrolled in either the online video training series or coming to the intensive diabetic alert dog trainer training classes, you can help Mary increase the number of dogs produced by legitimate trainers by at least 50 dogs per year, effectively increasing the output of trained dogs by 25% in just the first year!  Thats 50 additional lives saved.  Thats 50 additional birthdays, 600 additional monthly visits to grandma and grandpas house and 18,250 days children get to wake up to their healthy parent smiling at them!  And thats just the trainer training program...

In the new commercial property, Mary will have enough room to easily record and edit training videos by herself.  Currently Mary has only a half completed diabetic alert dog training video series that helps around 5 people per month learn to train their own diabetic alert dog.  Having a completed video program will allow Mary to reach a larger audience, an audience who is in desperate need for help because they cannot pay $25,000 for a trained dog.  Despite being the top migraine alert dog trainer in the country, Mary has no online program for migraine alert dog training.  This new space will allow her to provide a video program for this quality-of-life stealing disability.  With a incredibly conservative estimate of 5 people per month utilizing the videos, in one year we could help 60 people gain back their quality of life.  Thats 60 people potentially returning to the workforce due to their new found freedom from migraines, thats 10,950 stories read to children when they are being tucked into bed and 21,900 sunsets enjoyed on a daily basis.

You can make these dreams a reality.  Mary has helped 115 people enjoy the little things in life every day.  Help her help more people to become happier, more productive, giving, loving members of society by ridding them of their pain, anguish and suffering.

On a daily basis, the lives of 7 children are made whole through the use of a diabetic alert dog that was trained using Mary McNeight's techniques.


Can't Donate? You Can Help In Other Ways!

We know some of our students incomes are so tight that they just cannot financially give to the the campaign.  Thats OK.  Not every contribution has to be financial.  You can help this campaign by sharing it with your friends on social media, forwarding it to your local support group, sharing it on a blog or sending it to a media outlet like your local paper or TV station.  No effort is too small.  Everyone can help make a difference in the lives of people with disabilities.
story_txt:
Saving The Lives of Diabetics Since 2009 Mary McNeight is a certified, multi-national, award-winning, teacher, author, professional speaker, mentor and service dog expert witness who specializes in training service dogs for medical alert.  She has helped to train over 115 medical alert dogs across the world.  On a daily basis these dogs help to keep alive children, grandchildren, fathers, mothers, sisters, daughters, brothers, grandfathers, grandmothers, cousins, aunts and uncles.  She specializes in teaching dogs to alert to diabetes, seizures, narcolepsy and migraines. 


Mary McNeight has been featured in media outlets across the world as an expert on medical alert dog training.

Mary has not only helped people train their own medical alert dogs, she has also helped teach countless dog trainers across the world her techniques.  In addition to producing the first FREE ebook on how to chose a service dog candidate, she has produced over 40 videos on her Youtube channel that give people free advice about how to train their own dogs to alert to their medical conditions.  Mary McNeight has been recognized by the Association of Professional Dog Trainers as an expert in service dog training and was a featured speaker at their 6000+ member conference in 2013.  Mary McNeight started her company, Service Dog Academy in 2008 when she could find no one in her area to help her train her own medical alert dog.


Mary McNeight with Victoria Stilwell and Ian Dunbar at the 2012 Association of Professional Dog Trainers Conference where Mary won the Dr. Robert Curran NewTrix Video Award.
   A Place To Teach Puppies How To Save Their Owners Lives Mary McNeight used to teach classes out of her own training studio, but with commercial rental costs skyrocketing in Seattle and her focus on small, quality one-on-one training experiences, the over $25,000 a year rent for her tiny studio became too much to bear.  Mary is now moving to a small town in Illinois to be closer to family and to open up an expanded facility that will allow her to take her training to the next level.  Mary has located a commercial property that will allow her to, in addition to her current services, provide trained diabetic alert dogs to people who need them, create additional online video programs for people who want to train their own medical alert dogs, host dog training seminars for positive reinforcement trainers and provide the worlds-first live-work, hands-on, intensive dog trainer training program for people who want to learn how to train these life saving diabetic alert dogs.
Mary is looking to raise $325,000 to:



Purchase the commercial property


Install fencing to create an outside play area

Install state of the art flooring system in the training area
Purchase equipment (including but not limited to): crates, agility tunnels & equipment, tables, chairs, shelving, lighting and sound equipment
Convert a portion of the space into 2 private bedrooms for visiting trainers engaged in the live-work intensive diabetic alert dog trainer program

If the fundraising goal is not met Mary will continue to provide the medical alert dog training services she currently offers and will utilize the funds to expand her training services equal to the scale of donations.  Any and all money donated will go towards helping people train their own dogs to save their lives.


Mary McNeight teaching puppy classes in Seattle, WA.

What Kind Of Impact Can We Make Together? With over 25% of the population expected to have diabetes or pre-diabetes by 2020, the need for these lifesaving dogs is astronomical.  Unfortunately there are only a handful of professional dogs trainers across the country who are producing quality diabetic alert dogs.  With Mary's intensive trainer training program and online trainer training videos she can reach a wider audience.  She can only personally work with so many people per year, but if she shares her skills with other trainers, her ability to reach those in need effectively spiderwebs across the world!  You can help make this possible!  With just 10 trainers per year enrolled in either the online video training series or coming to the intensive diabetic alert dog trainer training classes, you can help Mary increase the number of dogs produced by legitimate trainers by at least 50 dogs per year, effectively increasing the output of trained dogs by 25% in just the first year!  Thats 50 additional lives saved.  Thats 50 additional birthdays, 600 additional monthly visits to grandma and grandpas house and 18,250 days children get to wake up to their healthy parent smiling at them!  And thats just the trainer training program...
In the new commercial property, Mary will have enough room to easily record and edit training videos by herself.  Currently Mary has only a half completed diabetic alert dog training video series that helps around 5 people per month learn to train their own diabetic alert dog.  Having a completed video program will allow Mary to reach a larger audience, an audience who is in desperate need for help because they cannot pay $25,000 for a trained dog.  Despite being the top migraine alert dog trainer in the country, Mary has no online program for migraine alert dog training.  This new space will allow her to provide a video program for this quality-of-life stealing disability.  With a incredibly conservative estimate of 5 people per month utilizing the videos, in one year we could help 60 people gain back their quality of life.  Thats 60 people potentially returning to the workforce due to their new found freedom from migraines, thats 10,950 stories read to children when they are being tucked into bed and 21,900 sunsets enjoyed on a daily basis.
You can make these dreams a reality.  Mary has helped 115 people enjoy the little things in life every day.  Help her help more people to become happier, more productive, giving, loving members of society by ridding them of their pain, anguish and suffering.
    

On a daily basis, the lives of 7 children are made whole through the use of a diabetic alert dog that was trained using Mary McNeight's techniques.


Can't Donate? You Can Help In Other Ways!

 We know some of our students incomes are so tight that they just cannot financially give to the the campaign.  Thats OK.  Not every contribution has to be financial.  You can help this campaign by sharing it with your friends on social media, forwarding it to your local support group, sharing it on a blog or sending it to a media outlet like your local paper or TV station.  No effort is too small.  Everyone can help make a difference in the lives of people with disabilities.

story:
Here's what Raymond Aaron, New York TImes Best Selling Author, says about  Phil's book:

"Phil has told his fascinating story about successfully conducting international business while living in Asia, Europe and the Middle East. Combining amusing first person anecdotes with perceptive reflections, he describes how you can learn and apply global best practices to double your income right here at home against your top competitors."

Learn more at www.globalize2x.com 

Hi 

I'm Doug Edgelow, a successful businessman from Phoenix, Arizona and I'm reaching out to you with a message that is very dear to my heart. As a parent and grandparent, I am very concerned that your family and mine will be badly affected by the growing number of aggressive international companies coming to America to share in our rich prosperity. 

My worry is that many of us could lose our jobs or companies as a result. These very capable competitors are using global best practices to succeed. American business people, employees and professionals need to do the same to maintain our share of America's prosperity. 

Fortunately, my close friends and colleagues Phil Richardson, Danielle Papillon, Bob Poline and I have worked out solutions that can be used by all Americans for your success. We are all committed to sharing them with you because we all have children and grandchildren who are counting on us to do our best for them. We want the best outcome for all Americans. 

For many years, we've worked successfully in countries around the world and we want to teach you our lessons learned. We will help you to improve your ability to compete with these new companies and double your income right here at home. To ensure that you and your family's future is secure, we sincerely believe that you must use our lessons learned to increase your prosperity. 

"Let's Help Make America Great Again"  as Ronald Reagan famously said. 

Here's How To Do It Without The Politicians!

Please join us in this vital effort by contributing to our campaign.

To succeed, we must fund our activities until we become self supporting. We'll make this happen through the sale of Phil's new book, A Step Ahead-Globalize To Double Your Income in which he shares his 60 Secrets For Success and from coaching fees. We teach our solutions to business owners and employees to improve their competitiveness and income.

 Our detailed financial forecast is available upon request to show you how we'll use the $75,000 we're aiming to raise to cover our costs until we become self sustaining. Please write to me at info@globalize2x.com and I'll provide all the details to you.

Learn more on our website where you can also contribute at:

http://www.globalize2x.com 

Please contribute to this vital cause to help us to launch it successfully. To encourage you to help us, we want to provide you with as many copies of Phil's book as you can take, with our thanks for your choice of donation level. Share them with family, friends, colleagues and clients or instead we'll send them to your favourite college or university for their students use.

We need as many apostles as we can get to make our campaign succeed and by reading Phil's book, we hope that you and they will gain the inspiration to join us.

We will send them to you separately enveloped and ready to conveniently gift them to those closest to you or we'll send them to your favorite college or university on your behalf.

I know you will enjoy reading Phil's fascinating book and his Sixty Secrets For Success will be very valuable to you. They will help you to increase your income significantly, which will in turn increase America's income and greatness. 

All funds we raise through this campaign will be devoted to supporting our important mission. You will be making a difference not only for yourself and your family but also for America, because we know you will spend the extra income that you earn right here at home. Your success is America's success! 

www.globalize2x.com

story:
The problem: 

Entrepreneurship facilitates ingenuity, innovation, and allows us to design solutions for society’s problems. All over the country, companies with fewer than than 500 employees create 65 percent of jobs -- and if these start-ups grow, so too would job opportunities and stability.

But the average college student today graduates with $30,000 in student debt -- which makes working for a cash-strapped startup difficult. 

The first step: 

Venture for America is a career accelerator that seeks to remedy this imbalance: the fellowship pairs recent grads who want to learn how to build a business while making an impact with promising start-ups in cities that need job growth.

But student debt is still a barrier to entry for so many potential VFA Fellows. This year, VFA  launched the Venture for America Opportunity Award for Loan Assistance, made possible by generous supporters in Providence, providing four Class of 2015 fellows with $5,000 each to jumpstart paying off loans. You can read about the specifics here. It's an excellent start, but as current fellows, we want to do more for our classmates, for our cities, and for our economy. Our team is hoping to start a tradition of raising funds for a fellow Fellow each year at training camp. You can help us get there.  

We need your support! 

Your donation will create a new opportunity for more young people to get involved in entrepreneurship - to be able to challenge themselves and learn how to create innovative impact. The money will go directly towards paying off a significant portion of a future Venture for America Fellow's loans. 

Plus, we have some great perks that connect you directly with the people you'll be impacting!

story:
I am Michael Kronmiller, a Senior at the Bullis School, in Potomac, Maryland. My passion is robotics, particularly in aviation. Two years ago I began a project to design a technology to find people in avalanches. The region I chose to focus on was Nepal because of the need to apply advanced technologies to rescue methods.



Not only did I want to design a technology to find people in avalanches, but also I wanted to help the areas affected by these catastrophes. With the help of a guide in Nepal we located Kanjirowa School whic was more than willing to work with us on the drone project. At the start of this campaign the students have received six drone kits with the help of Kashmir World Foundation, a U.S.-based organization that teaches students how to build drones.


I am trying to raise money to support the most critical phase of my international collaborative STEM project that is aimed at developing sensor-equipped, small unmanned aircraft systems (sUAS) for rescues of avalanche victims in Nepal. The project is both educational and humanitarian.  Please see nepalrobotics.org.  Because the drones and sensors are costly and systems tests must be conducted at Mount Everest, my expenses are enormous.  Crowdfunding is crucially important, right now, because my final testing is coming up in March!  

Avalanches in Nepal take lives and destroy homes, schools, businesses, and critical infrastructure—every year!  These events deal crippling blows to a national economy and remote localities that depend heavily on income from climbers and trekkers. Improved responses to avalanches will not only save lives, but also help people who greatly depend upon tourism in remote areas of Nepal.  This is where sensor-equipped sUAS for avalanche response can make a huge difference.  Contributions made now will help me with the most critical stage of research and development—on site tests of the full-scale prototype for the operational systems.  Moreover, funding for additional drone kits for high school students in Kathmandu will contribute to capacity-building, which promises to broaden and deepen Nepal’s nascent high tech efforts and thereby contribute to improving economic and social conditions in what is the fourth poorest country on earth.


I need $30,000, to fund my March trip to Nepal and the new system. In addition to round trip air fare, I also need to cover guide fees, hotels and meals—and chartering helicopters, at least $4,000 to and from each remote test site.  My family, my school, and the Kashmir World Foundation have already invested well over $25,000 in equipment and the 2015 trip to Nepal for proof-of-concept flight testing at Kala Patthar, 1000 feet above Everest Base Camp, and in the Annapurna Region. Distinguished attorneys, who are experts in drone law and export licensing have generously contributed their indispensable efforts pro bono. Other advisers, all distinguished in their fields, have kindly contributed countless hours to this project.  They are identified on my website, nepalrobotics.org.

If I do not reach my entire funding goal, I will use what I receive to defray my project expenses.  Since the biggest, single expense will likely be helicopter chartering, contributions will pay for that, first.  After that, contributions will be aimed at the fare for the international flights, guides, hotels, local ground transportation, and food.  If there are medical expenses, I will cover those, myself.

ALL DONATIONS TO THE PROJECT ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE TO THE EXTENT ALLOWED BY LAW (see: http://www.kashmirworldfoundation.org/#!donate/...)


I have to admit that this project is not like anything I have attempted, before.  When I came up with the idea, in December 2013, I had little idea of what I was going to face.  Getting this started was was not easy.  Assembling an advisory group of world-class experts was a big challenge.  Enlisting my brother was easy, but I had to ask a lot of him, including a journey to Nepal with me, for the flights of the early test models.  I should have done more, sooner, to enlist support from the public, but I really had my hands full with all the technical and management challenges.  Now that I am down to the wire for the final system tests in Nepal, I need that support and I need it soon.

I am the first to acknowledge the risks and obstacles.  Just getting to and from Nepal is not as simple as it might seem.  The world has a lot of tough places, and transiting some of them that lie between the U.S. and Nepal is potentially dangerous.  Before all that, I have to be sure my inoculations are up-to-date, I have to get my visa, and I have to be sure I have whatever U.S. export licenses and Nepal Government authorizations are required.  Things can go wrong at any one of those points, not to mention, when I get to Nepal.  Last trip, my brother became quite ill with acute gastroenteritis and acute mountain sickness, and had to be hospitalized.  The helicopter rides from Kathmandu to Kala Patthar and back were white knuckle experiences—but incredibly exciting.  I had more than a few hair raising moments on the roads and suspension bridges in remote areas, too.  But, the Kanjirowa School was a wonderful host, the guides were great professionals—and the homemade quadcopters flew!  One made it to over 19,000 feet from sea level.  It did have kind of an uncontrolled landing, but the damage was surprisingly slight.  You can see the videos at nepalrobotics.org.

I know what I am up against, but I am stoked for the next trip!  Flying drones at Mount Everest!  How cool is that!   My simple, little quad did it—so simple no export license was required.  My octocopter, “Guardian,” is far more robust, much more capable, and its programming is far more sophisticated.  The chances of a successful test flight are good, although I do plan to try to get the bird to fly to 23,000 feet at the Khumbu Icefall.  True, there is more than just flying and video facing me, next March, and I am well prepared to handle it. I have learned a lot about sensors and conditions at Everest and Annapurna, and I plan to meet with rescuers, while I am there, to deepen my practical knowledge. There is a lot more to this than the books, maps, and technical papers I have been studying for more than two years.

All physical perks will either be provided by me or by Cafe Press. I will be sending out a survey for shirt sizes at the end of May. Expect to receive your shipment sometime in July.

Adventure Samara, the coordinator in Nepal, is arranging discounts for travel, there, for major contributors.  I will be sending a survey out to you in May concerning itineraries, along with the Cafe Press survey.

All donations are tax deductible to the extent allowed by law. (see: http://www.kashmirworldfoundation.org/#!donate/...)

story:
Summary

  • We are The Foundation of WOMEN in HIP HOP. Our mission is to educate and empower the community through sharing love of the arts, inspiring growth, building leadership, and influencing the perceptions and roles of women in hip hop for current and future generations..
  • After 5 years of running a Successful Transformative Truly Open-Mic/Open Cipher Space in Detroit dedicated to Uplifting Women's Voices, Showcasing Women Talent, Conducting Healing Workshops, and Expanding Opportunities for Women Artists.We've been awarded a Knight Foundation matching grant to launch Detroit's 1st Women in Hip Hop Conference + Concert at #AMC2016 (Allied Media Conference) alliedmedia.org
  • Detroit’s 1st Contemporary Interactive Women in Hip Hop Conference will bring together leading figures in Detroit’s hip hop, digital media, art, dance, & performance communities to explore the historical & contemporary context, dynamics, impacts, and potential of Hip Hop music and culture on Women & ways Women are empowering themselves utilizing Hip Hop as a tool.
  • We'll Strengthen Detroit as a connected node in both the local and global dimensions of Hip Hop culture in the extensive network of cities that celebrate Women in Hip hop by showcasing workshops, performances, discussions, and media addressing topics that range from: the international cross-cultural impact to the intersection of Hip Hop and digital technology, creative commerce: making a living in today’s music industry, and storytelling across multiple platforms.

  • Special Presentation: The Poetics and Politics of Hip Hop Feminism: A Conversation with authors Aisha Durham, Ph.D (Home with Hip Hop Feminism: Performances in Communication and Culture ) and Ruth Nicole Brown, Ph.D (Hear Our Truths: The Creative Potential of Black Girlhood) featuring the band We Levitate. Moderated by Jessica Robinson and Blair E. Smith.

  • The three-day event will include a cipher, b-girl dance, film screening, hands-on workshops, a technology space, a recording experience, a mural, a network gathering, a community dinner, and panel discussions. The conference will also feature a concert showcasing the next generation of women in hip-hop. The concert will include performances by: 

    • Rapsody (headliner) - international artist who recently won a Grammy for her collaboration with Kendrick Lamar on the song “Complexion (Zulu Love).”

    • Mama Sol & The N.U.T.Z. - Flint, Mich. based Hip-Hop/ Neo Soul band committed to breaking the Self-Destructive cycle of mainstream Hip-Hop. Their vision is for a world prioritizing education, responsibility and art. The band features a collective of 4 musicians, background vocalist, lead MC & a disc jockey.

    • Mahogany Jones - Detroit-based artist most noted for her appearance on BET's 106 & Park Freestyle Fridays, she is also known around the world as a Hip-hop Ambassador having served with American Music Abroad and other programs under the United States Department of State Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs.

    • Master of Ceremonies: Jessica Care Moore, internationally renowned poet and producer of Black WOMEN Rock!

    • Concert Opener: Venus Fly, a street-dance based crew that battles, performs, and spreads knowledge of these dance styles & culture, will open with a break dancing performance.

    The women in hip-hop concert will take place http://bit.ly/rapsodyconcert.

    To register for the conference, go to https://www.alliedmedia.org/amc. Those who register for the conference will receive full access to the Allied Media Conference and be entered to win tickets to the concert.

What We Need:

  • We need $10,000 to cover free conference registrations for youth, travel and housing support, food for presenters and community dinner, paint and supplies for the mural and hands on workshops.

The Impact

The Women in Hip Hop Interactive Experience will bring together artists, activists and academics to creatively confront dominant misogynistic narratives in music and media. We will get to the root of how violence, and especially violence against women, became embedded in the cultural code of Hip Hop and we will rewrite that code to work towards the liberation of all people, drawing upon the brilliance of feminist Hip Hop activism, artistry, and scholarship.

Participants walk away with a greater understanding of the value of women in Hip Hop as a culture across disciplines.:  Art (Graffiti/StreetArt etc.), Dance, Technology (DJing/Music Production/Video), Words (Emceeing/FreeStyling/Writing/Rhyming/Poetry), and Culture (the Knowledge Element of reading, observing video and listening to audio media, discussion)

Risks & Challenges

One major risk to us achieving our goal of having a major youth presence is that the population we currently serve is considered in the "low-income" bracket and unable to afford the cost of entry to the conference.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:If you can donate supplies instead of money, that is also welcome.

  • paper (large/butcher), markers (500), easels (10), pens/pencils (500), composition books (300), PA system (1), floor (for dancing), sharpies (2x 24 pack), blank art books (150), paint brushes (175), paint (acrylic/spray paint)

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

And that's all there is to it.

After 5 years of running a Successful Transformative Truly Open-Mic/Open Cipher Space in Detroit dedicated to Uplifting Women's Voices, Showcasing Women Talent, Conducting Healing Workshops, and Expanding Opportunities for Women Artists.We've been awarded a Knight Foundation matching grant to launch Detroit's 1st Women in Hip Hop Conference + Concert at #AMC2016 (Allied Media Conference) alliedmedia.org

story:
What I do

My one-woman business, Hammond Charcuterie is two years old. Based in the Scottish Borders, I make delicious artisan charcuterie from locally sourced wild game and natural free-range produce supplied by several small farms. I also teach butchery and charcuterie skills to individuals and groups as well as selling my handmade produce at the popular Edinburgh Farmers Market.

Hammond Charcuterie's Website

Now I need to expand

As a self- taught butcher – and even rarer – a female butcher – my passion is to make and teach charcuterie. I am reviving traditional skills and recipes as well as planning to create 2 part time & full-time jobs,

Up until now, it has been only me – but I now need to expand, and to employ one or two members of staff as well as to create a dedicated professional butchery workshop. In this inspiring place, I will work and teach my classes in artisan charcuterie in pork, mutton, game and poultry; butchery, curing, smoking, and salami making.

My traditional Scottish charcuterie is featured by Slow Food Scotland as part of the Ark of Taste, which supports the continuation of traditional foods which are in danger of disappearing, we are working hard together to revive the art of charcuterie in Scotland. My new butchery will introduce many other people to the ancient skills and recipes which otherwise might be lost.

Crowd-funding the next step

As a one-woman start up, I have had an amazing adventure so far, pushing myself into a new career direction (I was an unhappy IT commuter in London) and also getting great advice and making new friends along the way. I have put everything I have into my business so I am crowd-funding this next step, and I want to share this exciting development, while I grow my lovely local business!


The new premises - Ayton Castle - The Old Potting Sheds

I have searching for the right building for a long while but and I have been lucky to recently acquire a lease on something perfect - beautiful old stone potting sheds in the grounds of Ayton Castle – a few miles from my home base, where I can ride my bicycle to work.

This is a fantastic opportunity to use these lovely old stone buildings as my dedicated butchery - as it has been many years they were “alive”, so you can imagine there is some work to be done before I can start making bacon there!

The team at the castle have already done huge of work, transforming the sheds from derelict, but now I need to make it into a proper butchery. Plastering, painting, new plumbing, electricals, a proper floor and some “new” second-hand kit to help make work more productive for the future.  

I need to crowd-fund £22,500

As well as a fully equipped craft butchery, retail space and demo area, there will be a traditional-style smoke-house which will enable me to smoke not only charcuterie but also fish, cheese, garlic, salt, chillies and much more.

My budget breakdown :

  • Large walk-in chill room (2m x 3m) £2000 including installation
  • Additional commerical fridges for butchery and for the retail space £2500
  • Water heater £200
  • Professional sinks and handwash sink £750
  • New second-hand sausage machine £500
  • Stainless steel butchery benches second-hand £1350
  • Lime plaster for walls and hygienic wainscotting £2500
  • Painting £850
  • Butchery equipment, second-hand, meat slicer, professional spice grinder, pro food processor and 100 litre boiler £4250
  • Wood work to create cleanable ceilings over old wooden beams £750
  • Wiring and plumbing, including drainage £1750
  • New professional floor, non slip and steam-cleanable £1500
  • Build new smoke-house £2500
  • Cooker £350
  • Racking and storage £750

If you come on one of my courses,  you will learn how to cure and smoke in this smoke-house. The joiner in the building next to the potential butchery has plenty of sweet shavings and sawdust so we have already have a mutually supportive community growing here, of small creative enterprises.

What I Need and What You Get

I would love to have your help to make my dream a reality; as a reward I've been thinking up some things which I think you'll really enjoy, as a thank you from discounts, or a stick of my artisan salamini by post, to vouchers for courses or up to a whole year's charcuterie delivered in monthly instalments to your door, or to the door of your chosen, lucky, recipient.

Every crowdfunder will automatically become a member of the Meat and Greet Club:-  You will automatically receive an invite to any launch parties and you’ll also be the first to hear about new products and classes, and you be certain to get every discount code for my planned, online shop.  

I have exhausted all other means of financial support and the only way I can achieve the move is with your help. 

Check out the great meaty Rewards & Perks I am offering - on the right!

The Impact - Bigger Picture

It has been wonderful to get receive huge interest from many local farms shops and delis; they are super keen to sell real charcuterie to their customers to reflect the richness and depth of our food heritage here.

If I am fortunate enough to meet my goal then I can go all-guns-out to create the new butchery. If I am very lucky and exceed the target, I will be able to create complete the signage for the new premises and plant up a small herb garden for produce to use in my charcuterie.

Other ways you can help - Please spread the word!

A massive favour to me would be to spread the word about my campaign. If you know someone who loves proper charcuterie then tell them about Hammond Charcuterie.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this, If you would like me to keep you informed of how the project is progressing then please sign up to my newsletter or you can follow me and spread the word on Facebook and Twitter

Hammond Charcuterie's Twitter Page

Hammond Charcuterie on Facebook
