story:
NOTE: Although you can no longer contribute through this site, your support is still needed :) If you would still like to contribute, please go to https://www.givengain.com/cause/1898/donate/#start

Three months ago I joined four young Xhosa surfers on their journey to becoming lifeguards!  It’s been an intense, awesome journey so far.

This international qualification is an incredible undertaking for our crew who only started swimming when they learnt to surf with the Unstressed Surf School (Unstressed) just over four years ago.  They have risen to the challenge and intensive training has begun. 

When Sandile (19), Lulama (19), Gana (18) and Anele (18) qualify, they will help ensure the safety of Chintsa’s visitors and residents (many of whom are not competent in the water), and will be employable as lifeguards. This is critical in a country where youth unemployment is at 54% (WB 2013) due to the lack of appropriate skills and meaningful job opportunities. 

Contributions from Unstressed fans have already covered the training costs of all four Lifeguards-in-the-making.

Any more support will help cover Sandile, Gana, Anele and Lulama’s stipends as they gain WORK EXPERIENCE and HELP SUPPORT WATER SAFETY on Chintsa East beach this summer.   

Stipends are essential as the four are prepared to not pursue other income generating activities in order to gain experience and support our safety on the beach this summer!

The four have shown that they have what it takes and now they need your support!  Go on! Help Sponsor a Lifeguard by contributing to their work experience – every bit will help!

Christmas is coming!  For a meaningful, quality gift why not support our four on behalf of your loved one and receive a customised Christmas card or Post card. Check out our Perks on the right of the screen!

CORPORATES: Your company can also use its CSI spend in this skills development initiative, while gaining B-BBEE points and brand mileage.  Contact us for more information.  

If you are a South African like me and would like to donate in our precious South African Rand, go to our website (www.friendsofchintsa.org) and click on “Donate Now” on the left.

Contact us for more information.

         A little bit of background

Unstressed Surf School is an initiative of Friends of Chintsa - a non-profit organisation operating since 2008 in the Chintsa area just outside East London in the Eastern Cape, South Africa.  Every weekend (weather permitting), a small number of local volunteers (myself included) meet with a group of Xhosa youngsters for a morning of sea, sun and surf.  Most of Unstressed’s members come from challenging socio-economic environments where there are high levels of unemployment, alcohol abuse and violence and limited access to healthy ways of having fun. 

The lifeguard course will be run by the East London Surf Lifesavers Club who have generously given us a discount on the course fee.  It is being held in East London (a costly 45 km from Chintsa) from the end of October 2015 through to the beginning of 2016.  It involves both theory and practical training - which invariably leaves these lifeguard hopefuls with a massive appetite!  I am providing additional support with logistics and training as well as extra tutoring (as the course work is in English and not isiXhosa – their first language) to help the trainees successfully pass the final lifeguarding test.  Finally we are ensuring that Anele, Gana, Lulama and Sandile have suitable kit to train and work in.

         Challenges and contingencies

Supporting the four senior surfers obtain their lifeguard qualification is important for Unstressed Surf School.  If we don’t raise enough, we will draw from funds allocated from other Unstressed activities.  We have now raised more than the minimum – which is great!  Any additional funds raised will support the Lifeguards’ work experience.  If we raise even more, funds will go back into Unstressed to support the daily running and activities that have, over the past five years, been developing awesome young Xhosa surfers and future lifeguards.

Both the theoretical and practical components of the lifeguard training will invariably be tough – after all, we need to be able to rescue someone from the ocean!  The Unstressed Surf School has full confidence in Sandile, Gana, Anele and Lulama’s ability to succeed!  Making sure that nothing is lost in translation and that they have enough nutrition for brain and muscle power during the sessions is where I come in!

Even if some of the surfers don’t pass the final lifeguard test; the knowledge, skills and experience gained will be invaluable.  Indeed, you don’t need to be a qualified lifeguard to react when you see someone in danger.  The experience will also provide a good basis if they choose to pursue lifeguard training again next year.

         Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Email friends, share on Facebook, paste of your Facebook page!  Go wild!  PS use the nifty share tools on the left!

story:
Hello tout le monde,

Certains d'entre vous le savent sans doute déjà : je pars avec Projects Abroad faire une mission d’enseignement de l’anglais pendant 3 mois, du 7 janvier au 7 avril, auprès d’enfants de Katmandou, au Népal.

Le Népal étant l'un des pays les plus pauvres au monde, le pays a un taux très élevé de chômage et d'illetrisme. Mais c'est également l'un des plus beaux pays de la planète, avec un héritage culturel très riche et, grâce à l'explosion du tourisme local, la maitrise de l’anglais est devenue essentielle. C'est pourquoi enseigner l'anglais à l'école permettrait aux enfants d’améliorer leurs chances de trouver un travail, aller plus loin dans leurs études et améliorer leurs chances d’un avenir meilleur.

Projects Abroad étant une organisation indépendante, je cherche à collecter un total de 3500€ pour couvrir l’organisation de ma mission par l'association, nourriture et hébergement dans une famille d'accueil, assurance voyage et santé, et ainsi de suite.

Si vous souhaitez m'aider à atteindre mon objectif de financement, n'hésitez pas à contribuer une petite somme et partager cette page avec votre entourage. Tous les dons, peu importe le montant, me seront d'une très grande aide.

Merci par avance de votre générosité, 
Cecilia

Pour plus d'info sur le projet : http://www.projects-abroad.fr/pays/nepal-volontariat/enseignement/

---

Hello friends,
Please join me in helping to educate young Nepalese children from the city of Kathmandu !

Some of you may have already heard : thanks to Projects Abroad, I will be setting off to Nepal, from January 7th to April 7th, to teach young teenagers how to speak English.

Nepal being one of the poorest countries in the world, it has a very high rate of illiteracy and unemployment.  But it is also one of the most beautiful and culturally rich places on earth, and because of the explosion of tourism, speaking English has become essential. This is why learning the English language from a young age is a way for children to access higher education, find a job, and improve their prospects for the future.

This mission being self-funded, I need to raise a total of 3,500€ that will go towards organizing my project, supporting my host family (food and accommodation), travel and health insurance and so on.

If you would like to help me achieve my fundraising goal, please consider contributing a little something and do not hesitate to share this page with your friends and family.  All donations, no matter how small, will be of great great help.

Most gratefully, 
Cecilia  

To know more about the project : http://www.projects-abroad.co.uk/volunteer-destinations/nepal/teaching/general-teaching-projects/

story:
Update 26th of November: only a few days left!

Only a few days left to enjoy our special offer on Indiegogo. The Illumina XL will continue to be on sale after the campaign ends, but at normal retail price of $199. Take advantage of this special offer while it lasts!

Update 19th of November: slightly delayed but shipping before Christmas

Unfortunately we are slightly delayed due to a delay in shipment of a key component by one of our suppliers, but we will be able to ship in time for Christmas.


We let YOU choose where you get your books from

If you look at today's e-reading market there are limited options for avid readers. E-readers based on E-Ink technology offer the most comfortable reading experience (no eye fatigue, perfect reading indoors, outdoors and even in bright sunlight, long battery life). However, most e-readers sold (Kindle, Kobo) lock you into their company's ecosystem, forcing you to buy books with them. Their business model is about getting customers into their system and making money on lifetime e-book sales.

New and innovative ways of reading books based on e-book subscriptions (for instance Scribd, Skoobe, Mobifo, Bliyoo) and library apps are growing rapidly in the last years as people come to realize that they prefer to have access to many books but at a fixed price per month. This is similar to the rise of apps such as Spotify and Netflix. These all you  can read apps however can not be used with those mainstream e-readers. 

From the moment Icarus was launched in the e-reading market in 2010, our philosophy has been the opposite: the choice where to get books from should always be with the reader and never with the manufacturer. That is why our e-readers have been 'open' from the start, supporting open standards and not based on lock-in systems. In 2014 we have moved to the Android operating system for our e-readers, which enables them to run all reading apps on the market today - and in the future. With an Icarus e-reader you can buy books in your favorite web shop, download free books, read via All-You-Can-Read subscriptions and more.


The all new Illumina XL 8" Android e-reader

Based on our successful Illumina 6" e-readers, Icarus is proud to present the all new Illumina XL:

The Illumina XL is compact, lightweight and comfortable to hold, despite its 8 inch E-Ink screen. This screen size is equivalent to a paperback paper book, the most popular format for reading in the world. Thanks to the slim bezel, 9mm thickness and one-button design (home button) we managed to keep the dimensions to a minimum. Weighing 275 grams, it weighs only 75 grams more than much smaller 6" devices.

The 8 inch screen offers 75% more screen surface, so more content fits on one page (meaning you need to flip pages less than with traditional 6" e-readers). Or you can increase the font size to make reading more comfortable.



The integrated front light enables comfortable reading even in low light situations and of course the XL has a touchscreen, Wi-Fi and plenty of storage for your books.

What makes the Illumina XL truly unique, it its compatibility with all e-book platforms. From e-book web shops to all-you-can-read subscriptions, from public libraries to public domain books and more. 



Out-of-the box our Illumina XL e-reader - running on Android 4.2 - can run apps from all reading platforms, such as Scribd, Skoobe, Kindle, Kobo, Mobifo, Bliyoo and many more. Public libraries have Android reading apps to, so with our e-readers you can also lend books at your library. If you own a library of books of a closed ecosystem already (for instance Kindle) you can easily access it on the Illumina using the Kindle app. By using cloud storage apps like Dropbox (pre-installed) or others, you can access your library stored in the cloud.

Below you find some screenshots of apps running on the Illumina XL:


The Illumina XL is also future proof: as Android is the dominant mobile device operating system you can rest assured that any future reading app will be available on Android.



Full specifications:

  • 8" (20.32cm) E-Ink touchscreen (1024 x 768)
  • Integrated frontlight (adjustable intensity and can be turned off)
  • Wi-Fi
  • Android 4.2: install your own apps
  • 1Ghz Dual Core A9 Cortex with 512MB RAM
  • 8 Gb internal memory
  • Micro SD card slot for expanding the memory with maximum 32Gb
  • Supports ePub and PDF with Adobe DRM and in addition FB2, RTF, MOBI, TXT, HTM
  • Audio support (MP3) and 3.5mm headphone jack
  • Battery: 2,800mAh Lithium Ion
  • 200 x 145 x 9mm, 275 gr.


Icarus is active worldwide, from Amsterdam to Munich, from Toronto to New Delhi. Thousands of customers have purchased our e-readers over the last years. We offer e-readers for all customer groups, from casual readers to avid readers and professionals that use e-readers for sustained reading and creating a paperless office. Our customer base values our fairly priced but advanced devices and favors open systems versus being locked in. Now is the time for you to join them!


What We Need & What You Get

We have finalized the design and specification phase for our e-reader and have first engineering samples available. In order to proceed to the next stage and mass produce the e-readers we need to invest in raw materials and components. We have invested $75,000 so far and need an additional $57,000 in order to finalize that phase.

The first e-readers will be produced in November 2015, shipments to the Indiegogo contributors will take place in the first half of December 2015.

Update: some visitors have asked what happens with their contribution if we do not reach the funding goal. The answer is very simple: we will still ship you the e-readers you selected as a perk! We are producing the Illumina XL in any case, but if we reach or exceed the funding goal we will increase the production volume to satisfy the demand.


We have a couple of great perks for our contributors:



This is a flexible funding campaign, we will use the funds to move the product into the production phase. 

Timeline

The Illumina XL is ready to hit the mass production phase, which will enable us to deliver the product still before Christmas, which is a big gifting occasion for e-readers.

  • November 2015: first mass production run
  • December 2015: shipments to backers
  • January 2015: second production run


The company

The Icarus brand belongs to Distriread B.V., one of the pioneering companies in the e-reader market in the Netherlands. DistriRead originated from the company iRex that developed one of the first E-Ink e-readers many years ago. Since 2008 DistriRead is active in the e-reader market and in 2010 the Icarus brand was founded. Icarus products are sold worldwide by a network of distributors and major retailers and e-tailers like Mediamarkt, Fnac, Expert, Coolblue, Paradigit, Vobis, Bol.com to name a few. 

The Icarus team is composed of a mix of people with a combined experience in the consumer electronics industry of more than 20 years.

DistriRead is located in the city of Eindhoven, the tech capital of the Netherlands.

DistriRead B.V. |  Luchthavenweg 81 - 1.39a  |  5657 EA  |  Eindhoven  | The Netherlands  |  +31 40 304 00 10  |  info@icarusreader.com


FAQ

Q: Why would I not just read on my phone or tablet?

A: For casual reading on the go you could use a phone or tablet. But only E-Ink devices offer you a comfortable reading experience if you are reading for longer periods as the screen does not lead to eye fatigue. Also if you want to read outside on a LCD screen this is very difficult due to the reflections. If you are serious about reading, the best device to do so on is an e-reader.

Q: How can I read Kindle books on the Illumina XL?

A: For reading Kindle books on the Icarus e-reader, simply run the Kindle App. This will allow you to access your existing library and to read those books.


Q: How can I read Kobo books on the Illumina XL?

A: For reading Kobo books on the Icarus e-reader, simply run the Kobo App. This will allow you to access your existing library and to read those books.


Q: How can I use apps like Skoobe so I can read unlimited books at a monthly fee?

A: Simply install the Skoobe app on the Illumina. It will be available in the apps section of your e-reader after installation. In a similar way you can install and run other reading apps


Q: Is it possible to listen to audio books

A: Yes, the Illumina XL supports the MP3 audio format and has a 3.5mm audio jack


Q: Do you ship to my country too?

A: We ship our e-readers worldwide via Fedex and DPD. Shipping to the US, Canada and the European Union is free. For other countries there is a $25 shipping charge.

Unfortunately we are slightly delayed due to a delay in shipment of a key component by one of our suppliers, but we will be able to ship in time for Christmas.

We let YOU choose where you get your books from

 If you look at today's e-reading market there are limited options for avid readers. E-readers based on E-Ink technology offer the most comfortable reading experience (no eye fatigue, perfect reading indoors, outdoors and even in bright sunlight, long battery life). However, most e-readers sold (Kindle, Kobo) lock you into their company's ecosystem, forcing you to buy books with them. Their business model is about getting customers into their system and making money on lifetime e-book sales.
New and innovative ways of reading books based on e-book subscriptions (for instance Scribd, Skoobe, Mobifo, Bliyoo) and library apps are growing rapidly in the last years as people come to realize that they prefer to have access to many books but at a fixed price per month. This is similar to the rise of apps such as Spotify and Netflix. These all you  can read apps however can not be used with those mainstream e-readers. 
From the moment Icarus was launched in the e-reading market in 2010, our philosophy has been the opposite: the choice where to get books from should always be with the reader and never with the manufacturer. That is why our e-readers have been 'open' from the start, supporting open standards and not based on lock-in systems. In 2014 we have moved to the Android operating system for our e-readers, which enables them to run all reading apps on the market today - and in the future. With an Icarus e-reader you can buy books in your favorite web shop, download free books, read via All-You-Can-Read subscriptions and more.




The all new Illumina XL 8" Android e-reader
Based on our successful Illumina 6" e-readers, Icarus is proud to present the all new Illumina XL:



The Illumina XL is compact, lightweight and comfortable to hold, despite its 8 inch E-Ink screen. This screen size is equivalent to a paperback paper book, the most popular format for reading in the world. Thanks to the slim bezel, 9mm thickness and one-button design (home button) we managed to keep the dimensions to a minimum. Weighing 275 grams, it weighs only 75 grams more than much smaller 6" devices.
The 8 inch screen offers 75% more screen surface, so more content fits on one page (meaning you need to flip pages less than with traditional 6" e-readers). Or you can increase the font size to make reading more comfortable.





The integrated front light enables comfortable reading even in low light situations and of course the XL has a touchscreen, Wi-Fi and plenty of storage for your books.
What makes the Illumina XL truly unique, it its compatibility with all e-book platforms. From e-book web shops to all-you-can-read subscriptions, from public libraries to public domain books and more. 



Out-of-the box our Illumina XL e-reader - running on Android 4.2 - can run apps from all reading platforms, such as Scribd, Skoobe, Kindle, Kobo, Mobifo, Bliyoo and many more. Public libraries have Android reading apps to, so with our e-readers you can also lend books at your library. If you own a library of books of a closed ecosystem already (for instance Kindle) you can easily access it on the Illumina using the Kindle app. By using cloud storage apps like Dropbox (pre-installed) or others, you can access your library stored in the cloud.

Below you find some screenshots of apps running on the Illumina XL:



The Illumina XL is also future proof: as Android is the dominant mobile device operating system you can rest assured that any future reading app will be available on Android.





Full specifications:



8" (20.32cm) E-Ink touchscreen (1024 x 768)

Integrated frontlight (adjustable intensity and can be turned off)
Wi-Fi
Android 4.2: install your own apps

1Ghz Dual Core A9 Cortex with 512MB RAM

8 Gb internal memory
Micro SD card slot for expanding the memory with maximum 32Gb
Supports ePub and PDF with Adobe DRM and in addition FB2, RTF, MOBI, TXT, HTM
Audio support (MP3) and 3.5mm headphone jack
Battery: 2,800mAh Lithium Ion
200 x 145 x 9mm, 275 gr.




Icarus is active worldwide, from Amsterdam to Munich, from Toronto to New Delhi. Thousands of customers have purchased our e-readers over the last years. We offer e-readers for all customer groups, from casual readers to avid readers and professionals that use e-readers for sustained reading and creating a paperless office. Our customer base values our fairly priced but advanced devices and favors open systems versus being locked in. Now is the time for you to join them!


What We Need & What You Get We have finalized the design and specification phase for our e-reader and have first engineering samples available. In order to proceed to the next stage and mass produce the e-readers we need to invest in raw materials and components. We have invested $75,000 so far and need an additional $57,000 in order to finalize that phase.
The first e-readers will be produced in November 2015, shipments to the Indiegogo contributors will take place in the first half of December 2015.
Update: some visitors have asked what happens with their contribution if we do not reach the funding goal. The answer is very simple: we will still ship you the e-readers you selected as a perk! We are producing the Illumina XL in any case, but if we reach or exceed the funding goal we will increase the production volume to satisfy the demand.

We have a couple of great perks for our contributors:








This is a flexible funding campaign, we will use the funds to move the product into the production phase.     
Timeline

  The Illumina XL is ready to hit the mass production phase, which will enable us to deliver the product still before Christmas, which is a big gifting occasion for e-readers.  November 2015: first mass production run
December 2015: shipments to backers
January 2015: second production run    


The company
The Icarus brand belongs to Distriread B.V., one of the pioneering companies in the e-reader market in the Netherlands. DistriRead originated from the company iRex that developed one of the first E-Ink e-readers many years ago. Since 2008 DistriRead is active in the e-reader market and in 2010 the Icarus brand was founded. Icarus products are sold worldwide by a network of distributors and major retailers and e-tailers like Mediamarkt, Fnac, Expert, Coolblue, Paradigit, Vobis, Bol.com to name a few. 
The Icarus team is composed of a mix of people with a combined experience in the consumer electronics industry of more than 20 years.
DistriRead is located in the city of Eindhoven, the tech capital of the Netherlands.
DistriRead B.V. |  Luchthavenweg 81 - 1.39a  |  5657 EA  |  Eindhoven  | The Netherlands  |  +31 40 304 00 10  |  info@icarusreader.com




FAQ 
Q: Why would I not just read on my phone or tablet?
A: For casual reading on the go you could use a phone or tablet. But only E-Ink devices offer you a comfortable reading experience if you are reading for longer periods as the screen does not lead to eye fatigue. Also if you want to read outside on a LCD screen this is very difficult due to the reflections. If you are serious about reading, the best device to do so on is an e-reader.

Q: How can I read Kindle books on the Illumina XL?
A: For reading Kindle books on the Icarus e-reader, simply run the Kindle App. This will allow you to access your existing library and to read those books.


Q: How can I read Kobo books on the Illumina XL?
A: For reading Kobo books on the Icarus e-reader, simply run the Kobo App. This will allow you to access your existing library and to read those books.


Q: How can I use apps like Skoobe so I can read unlimited books at a monthly fee?
A: Simply install the Skoobe app on the Illumina. It will be available in the apps section of your e-reader after installation. In a similar way you can install and run other reading apps

Q: Is it possible to listen to audio books
A: Yes, the Illumina XL supports the MP3 audio format and has a 3.5mm audio jack

Q: Do you ship to my country too?
A: We ship our e-readers worldwide via Fedex and DPD. Shipping to the US, Canada and the European Union is free. For other countries there is a $25 shipping charge.

story:
Short Summary
The inspiration behind Studio Samuel
  • When I brought home my son, Niko Samuel (pronounced sam-well), the concept of Studio Samuel was born. My experiences visiting Ethiopia during the adoption process were eye opening, realizing the insurmountable need of those living in dire poverty. What was particularly unsettling to see were the barriers women faced on a regular basis– access to education & healthcare, child marriage, forced labor, human trafficking, abuse and more. The images and stories would be forever ingrained in my mind. You can't walk away from that.

  • Studio Samuel opened doors in the capital city, Addis Ababa, and Training for Tomorrow officially launched with 25 girls and their caregivers. Training for Tomorrow is our trademarked program, which brings an innovative approach to teaching the Ten Core Life Skills, as established by the World Health Organization (WHO), UNESCO, UNICEF and more.
  • Part of this innovative approach includes computer programming. Everything changed following our students' participation in Africa Code Week this year. This was it!
  • A Training for Tomorrow graduate is armed with the  life skills to stand on her own. The added value of being skilled in an industry proven to have a significant growth rate, globally, is life-changing for girls in our program. No matter the size of your contribution, each person supporting our campaign is playing a vital role in altering the future path of a girl otherwise facing vulnerable, limited and sometimes dangerous employment options.

How does our Training for Tomorrow coding center work?

We train 35 girls  (eventually 100) all living at, or below, the poverty line. Computer Science majors and professors from a local university mentor our students in the lab. Students are challenged with projects based on skill-sets and work with their teams to create solutions.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $10,000USD to expand our computer lab at our training center in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. Here is what we can cover with your support:

  • Expansion of our current lab to accommodate classes of 20 students in one session.

  • Provide 5 more laptops for the center and more wiring.

  • Purchase equipment for the classroom i.e ( projector, chairs, tables, white boards)

  • Provide stipend for IT students and professors leading the class.


    The Perks!

    • Fair Trade Ethiopian coffee (the best!) in soft, raw cotton bags signed by Julian Lennon (photographer, philanthropist, musician and Studio Samuel Advisor)
    • Portraits of select Training for Tomorrow students, shot at our compound by talented photographer, John Delaney with handwritten lyrics by Julian Lennon
    • Studio Samuel signature jewelry locally made in Ethiopia from melted artillery trade beads with artisans receiving fair wages & healthcare
    • ...and more perks coming in from our music industry friends lending their support - Elvis Costello signed guitar, Jason Aldean signed guitar, Joseph Arthur painting, Soundgarden framed show poster (signed by all members) and more...


    The Impact of Training for Tomorrow

                                            

    "Organizations like Studio Samuel Foundation are critical to helping educate women and giving them the skills and confidence to improve their livelihoods and those of their families."   - Sheryl WuDunn | co-creator of A Path Appears and Half the Sky Movement


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Share, share, share! By raising awareness of our campaign, you're making impact. The ripple effect will be in full force through Giving Tuesday!  ;)

story:
Integrated Childcare Centers of Cairo

Egypt which is the region's most over populated nation happens to have the most serious street children problem in Africa & the Middle East. 1 in 5 small children die before the age of 5, many of which are homeless street kids.

Most NGO's aren’t equipped with the proper grassroots solutions to solve the street kid's phenomenon & are therefore ineffective, resulting in many of these vulnerable kids falling back in to the cycle of victimization & exploitation.

The proposed center will have branches in many parts of the country starting by a model branch in one of the communities of Cairo with the optimum child/cost benefit ratio. The centers will be implemented in phases.

5 AMAZING REASONS WHY WE WILL DO IT BETTER:

We have made providing protection, hope & dignity to vulnerable street children our business. We clothe, feed, & care for small children, teaching them while also giving them the tools to regain a positive outlook on life & to become successful participating members of society.

Prevention

Harm reduction

Creating social entrepreneurs out of successfully assisted street kids

Promoting true social solidarity in centers' community

On site professional psychologists,

Emphasis on elite competitive sports programs for self confidence & discipline & an incentive to stay in school,

We will offer non financial lifetime assistance

Top notch expat & local volunteer social workers,

Mentoring by successful peers [street kids who have made it out]

True human rights and legal affairs protection,

Stipends to families

BUDGET - WHERE IS YOUR MONEY GOING:

Breakdown of 1 Year Running Costs of $56,500 – or 2 year running cost of $113,000

1.  Building rent $1000 monthly

2.  The Center will have sleeping quarters for those children who have no homes to go to at the end of the day. $4,000.

3.  In addition, the Center will have day-use quarters for other children being assisted and who have homes and families. Prevention & harm reduction $2,000.

4.  The center will have learning classes & social work units, We offer education or the chance to stay enrolled in schools. With an average tuition cost of only LE 400 ($US 51) X 50 kids. $,2,550.

5.  Small medical treatment quarters, $2,000.

6.  Outdoor sports area, $1,000.

7.  An entertainment and recreational section, State of the art TV/Projector for lectures and movie viewing $1,000, Couches & chairs $3,000.

8.  Each child would be examined, cleaned, clothed, evaluated and a file prepared for him/her. $10, 000 [for 50 kids full boarders & day kids].

9.  Eating facilities to cater for three meals for the entire sleeping population of the Center, children and staff, and lunch for the day kids and staff; $10,000.

10.  Dormitories with separate supervised sections for both boys and girls; $5,000.

11.  Vocational training facilities with trainers for those nearing the age of 18 $1,200 annually.

12.  Staff monthly salaries: On site Nurse $400 monthly, Social Workers $300 each, teachers $300, bilingual secretary/administrative assistant $300. Total $15,600

13.  Contingency for human rights lawyers & logistics $2,000. Numerous volunteers are major contributors as well.

14.  Monitored $8 monthly pension for kids – 50 per year. $2,400 annually – if we reach our fundraising goal.

For now, these kids just need any semblance of hope, as soon as possible. Please help them because a little goes such a Long Way.

Main Trustees Linkden Profiles:

Dr Essam Mitwally –Senior UN advisor & honorary UNHCR ambassador for Africa

http://tinyurl.com/hc3e9pl

Mr. Samer Mitwally – Former regional manager Pearson Education & Training

http://tinyurl.com/jskgpz7

Ms. Dalia Sabet – USAID Senior Operations Manager

http://tinyurl.com/gtlfptu

God Bless you for caring & giving.

story:
The Mission of ProjectAscension.com is to enlighten the world about the Universe's hidden history, and how human history has been influenced and manipulated  in the past and the present by outside worldly forces. The Sumerian tablets explain the Annunaki's role in the evolution of humanity as slaves for precious resources and gold. 

ProjectAscension.com strongly believes in saving our planet and human species before it is too late.  It is our goal to assist humanity in waking up to the syncretism of theories, facts, and prophecies by our most ancient recorded ancestors. 

All donations accepted and revenues generated minus minimal operational costs on ProjectAscension.com will be used to purchase and donate Tesla PowerWall home batteries in future natural disaster plagued areas in the United States Click To Learn More About Tesla PowerWall Batteries. We will also use revenues to donate to selected charities as well as helping selected homeless persons because we were recently homeless ourselves.

Be the change you want to see in the world!

story:
My hero of a mum and little sister have signed up to do a sky dive to help raise money to enable a team of us to go and volunteer in an orphanage in Cuttack, India. So on December 9 they'll be conquering some rather large fears and tumbling out of a plane from an altitude of 13,000 feet, strapped to two strapping men (or ladies).

About Restoration Home Orphanage:

Lal Rodinga Colney's orphanage has been operating for 10 years. Situated in Cuttack, Orissa - one of the poorest parts of India - it accommodates boys aged between 3 and 17. These are mainly abandoned street children or destitute and homeless boys who were rejected by parents. Some of them lost their fathers and mothers who died in the violent wave of persecution against Christians in Orissa three years ago. Others are orphans with no other means of support.

Each day they feed 100+ street children and teach them basic health and hygiene.

http://www.restoration-church.in/projects

What we'll be doing:

In Feb/March 2016 Sarah Hawkins, Marie Lutter, Zohra and myself (Ruth) will be going to Cuttack for two to three weeks to help in the orphanage and with the street children. We are hoping to be able to tie in a 3 day training session for evangelists and leaders working with new churches in the villages.

The orphanage is in need of two laptops/computers for the children to use. There is also a need for play equipment which we would like to be able to provide so any money raised on top of the cost of the trip will be put to this.

This is a self financed trip so any support you can give would be greatly appreciated. I am really excited that an opportunity like this has come up for me, as much as I love Northampton, it will be good for my sights and faith to be broadened. I'm particularly keen on seeing how we can help with the street children and I'm sure this will become clearer as we work with Colney and team over the next few months.  

Thank you!

Registered charity number: 1107952

story:
I am Adriana Bertini an Artvist from Brazil.

Since 1995 I have worked as an artist and activist in the fight against AIDS in worldwide.

Condom Couture is my multidisciplinary art project to debate hiv-aids prevention e awareness and promote  A Different Approach To Sex Education.

From 16 to July 22, 2016 Happens 21th International AIDS Conference in Durban, South Africa.

http://www.aids2016.org/

Why I need be there?  The International AIDS Conference is the premier gathering for those working in the field of HIV, as well as policy makers, persons living with HIV and other individuals committed to ending the pandemic. It is a chance to assess where we are, evaluate recent scientific developments and lessons learnt, and collectively chart a course forward. The AIDS 2016 programme will present new scientific knowledge and offer many opportunities for structured dialogue on the major issues facing the global response to HIV. A variety of session types – from abstract-driven presentations to symposia, bridging and plenary sessions – will meet the needs of various participants. Other related activities, including the Global Village, satellite symposia, the Exhibition and affiliated independent events, will contribute to an exceptional opportunity for professional development and networking.

Please I really  need your support to bring innovations related to HIV prevention to my community.

Using money raised:

a) 1 round trip sao paulo durban sao paulo

b) Aids conference registration

c) airport transfers

d) hotel

e) food

f) local transportation

g) transportation of condom art pieces

My condom art will be part of the show: Through Positive Eyes from UCLA Art & Global Health Center

http://artglobalhealth.org/throughpositiveeyes/

Thank you so much!

keek in touck

Adriana Bertini
condomart@gmail.com
whats +5511979578000

––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––


Oi Pessoal esta é a famosa vaquinha online, super fácil de doar!

Eu sou Adriana Bertini artista plástica e ativista brasileira.

Desde 1995 tenho trabalhado como um artista e ativista na luta contra ao HIV/AIDS no Brasil e no mundo.

Condom Couture é o meu projeto de arte multidisciplinar para debater a prevenção e conscientização. Minhas obras estar sendo expostas em um evento parceiro da conferencia: ''Olhares Positivos'' - uma iniciativa da universidade de Los Angeles UCLA e do departamento de Arte e Saúde em HIV.

De 16 a 22 de julho de 2016 acontece Conferência Internacional de AIDS 21th em Durban, África do Sul.

É o maior evento que reúne mais de 10 mil pessoas de todo o mundo. Ativista, médicos, cientistas, funcionários da saúde, líderes de opinião, midia e a comunidade global de luta contra aids que tem  o mesmo objetivo em comum: estudar, aprender e compartilhar experiências na luta contra aids para o fim da aids no mundo.

Por favor, eu realmente preciso de seu apoio para trazer inovações relacionadas com a prevenção do HIV para minha comunidade.

Usando o dinheiro arrecadado:

a) 1 bilhete aéreo ida e volta trecho São Paulo / Durban / São Paulo

b) Inscrição na conferência

c) 4Translados

d) Hotel

e) Alimentação

f) Transporte local

g) Transporte de obras de arte de preservativos

Conto com seu apoio em mais esta parceria! Super obrigado!

Adriana Bertini
condomart@gmail.com
whats +5511979578000

I
am Adriana Bertini an Artvist from Brazil. Since 1995 I have worked as
an artist and activist in the fight against AIDS in worldwide. 
Condom Couture is my multidisciplinary art project to debate
hiv-aids prevention e awareness and promote  A Different Approach To Sex Education.From
16 to July 22, 2016 Happens 21th International AIDS Conference in Durban,
South Africa.http://www.aids2016.org/
Why I need be there?  The International AIDS Conference is the premier gathering for those 
working in the field of HIV, as well as policy makers, persons living 
with HIV and other individuals committed to ending the pandemic. It is a
 chance to assess where we are, evaluate recent scientific developments 
and lessons learnt, and collectively chart a course forward. The AIDS 2016 programme will present new scientific knowledge and 
offer many opportunities for structured dialogue on the major issues 
facing the global response to HIV. A variety of session types – from 
abstract-driven presentations to symposia, bridging and plenary sessions
 – will meet the needs of various participants. Other related 
activities, including the Global Village, satellite symposia, the 
Exhibition and affiliated independent events, will contribute to an 
exceptional opportunity for professional development and networking.
Please I really  need your
support to bring innovations related to HIV prevention to my community.Using money raised:a) 1 round trip sao paulo durban sao paulob) Aids conference registrationc) airport transfersd) hotele) foodf) local transportationg) transportation of condom art piecesMy condom art will be part of the show: Through Positive Eyes from UCLA Art & Global Health Centerhttp://artglobalhealth.org/throughpositiveeyes/Thank you so much!keek in touckAdriana Bertinicondomart@gmail.comwhats +5511979578000––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––Oi Pessoal esta é a famosa vaquinha online, super fácil de doar!Eu sou Adriana
Bertini artista plástica e ativista brasileira.

Desde 1995 tenho trabalhado como um artista e ativista na luta contra ao
HIV/AIDS no Brasil e no mundo.

Condom Couture é o meu projeto de arte multidisciplinar para debater a
prevenção e conscientização. Minhas obras estar sendo expostas em um evento parceiro da conferencia: ''Olhares Positivos'' - uma iniciativa da universidade de Los Angeles UCLA e do departamento de Arte e Saúde em HIV.

De 16 a 22 de julho de 2016 acontece Conferência Internacional de AIDS 21th em
Durban, África do Sul.

É o maior evento que reúne mais de 10 mil pessoas de todo o mundo. Ativista,
médicos, cientistas, funcionários da saúde, líderes de opinião, midia e
a comunidade global de luta contra aids que tem  o mesmo objetivo em comum: estudar, aprender e compartilhar
experiências na luta contra aids para o fim da aids no mundo.
Por favor, eu realmente preciso de seu apoio para trazer inovações relacionadas
com a prevenção do HIV para minha comunidade.

Usando o dinheiro arrecadado:

a) 1 bilhete aéreo ida e volta trecho São Paulo / Durban / São Paulo

b) Inscrição na conferência 

c) 4Translados

d) Hotel

e) Alimentação

f) Transporte local

g) Transporte de obras de arte de preservativos

story:
We know the face of bravery.

 

There were 2705 firefighters who “Beat the Beast”. Know that you can support our brave heroes and in rebuilding the lives of those harmed by the fire by proudly wearing a pair of our limited edition, unique socks.

 

Donate $30 to the Canadian Red Cross through us and we will send you a gift of a pair of collector, unique socks. Donate $53 and you’re gifted two pairs of these unique socks.

 

In order to start and meet production costs for 2705 of the durable pair of “Beat the Beast” socks, we want to achieve a goal of $21,000. After the goal is met, orders will be fulfilled in November and delivered to your home!

 

The 4th CMRA is proud to support the bravery and sacrifice of the Fort McMurray defenders and we thank you for your support through the Canadian Red Cross.

 

"Beat the Beast"

 

Join our Facebook group to learn more about the "Beat the Beast” campaign and the 4th CMRA
